Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will tell you the quality of the growths of that cauterizing and the danger of it; and in what combination it is forbidden to cauterize.

E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia . In the combination of tail and dry matter is disagree; for some say that cauterizing is beneficial to that, and others say the opposite, that cauterizing is not suitable in a dry disease which has quality and dryness, since the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is not suitable that such a dry disease be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he who says the opposite of that, that by cauterizing is made beneficial in all dry disease which has quality and dryness, because when you compare the bodies of men with the moisture of them to the combination of fire, you find the bodies of men burning.

And you know, children, that of the secret of cure by cautery with fire and of the goodness of it, is because the fire is simple, the action of which does not reach but to the member that is cauterized and not to the other member by the application thereof but to a slight injury.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of the burning medicine reaches to that in the members which makes it very hot, and does not cool but brings fever; it very much hurts the member that is being cauterized, but does not hurt that which is opposite.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas. E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps. E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the malady return at any hour of time, according to the complexity of the malady and the location of the malady and the goodness of it, and because of this, it is prepared in its body by the addition of superfluous things in it, and because of which it is obtained from it in its acquisition in food and semblantz of those causes; but that the malady for which cauterization is administered is a subtle malady in a member of few superfluous things and moisture, then cauterization of tooth for pain and resembling that one, it is possible that in him does not return that pain, but comes in small.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And however the popular speech is that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a foolish speech, not to those who understand it, because they believe that it is a cure which profits by medicine or by another cause; but that the speech is right to you, children, because I will explain why.

And the cause is opposite to that; and my intention that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine is only when we administer the methods of cure in some diseases, and those medicines do not profit, and at the end of the cause we administer cauterization, and it profits to him.

De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauterization with pains of the head because of coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias. E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They recommend exhaling the vapors from above that spot.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound be kept open for a long time, and then let it be cured within so that it hardens.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not see these two types of cauterization in all places, but in some cases out of fear; and this one, in my opinion, is better to save when it is necessary because the head is a central part for the continuity of life in the whole body, and more so when the patient' head is of frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cauterization is better saved and more useful to me; and from that, I choose this work to save life.
Capitol segon.	Second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the head cauterization.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the whole head chronic and prolonged pain occurs due to water in the skull, and it is used with scalpel and scythes and poultices and plasters and compresses and balms, and more so if the head has already been cauterized with a cauterizer that was not effective for some reason, then consider that since the patient' head is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not pleasant and causes a great pain, then let another cauterization be performed after a short time.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then let that one be cauterized on the edge of his hairline with cautery within so that the cord is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Then cut the cord and expose a small amount of bone where we have counted and cauterize that one with a cauterizer in the back of the head at the location called "vas," — and this is the spot where wind is felt.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And rejoice in your healing, and do not expose the bone because the water causes great pain that is different from the pain of all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And let this cauterization be performed in its location, because, as we have said, the cauterization with which the hairline of the head and the occiput are treated is subtler cauterization than that with which the back of the head is treated; and this is the form.
Capitol ters.	Third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cauterization for emigre.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When pain in the edge of the head is hard, or there is pain inside the ear, then wash the head with medicine, and administer another treatment, which I have described in the causes of headaches; and if it does not benefit, then cauterize it in two ways: either with burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Perhaps cauterizing with burning medicine is better than taking a dolent of ale, and scraping that one and cleaning the ends from both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then cut the area of pain in the temple with a sharp scalpel within so that the cord is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then tighten it on the affected area with a strong constriction, and leave it for three hours; then dip the area in oil, and leave the plague for two or three days, and then place it under water within the location where the pain is felt.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then let that one be cured with ointment so that it heals.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you want, there are some medicines described in the second book of burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Perhaps cauterizing with iron according to this method:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	And it is called a small peg, because the head is thus shaped like a peg and there is a small curve in its middle; and in the middle of it is a slight prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place it on the painful spot, and hold your hand away from it — so that the iron does not burn your hand — and move the small piece of iron slowly over the area.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of the liquid that is absorbed by the tissue of the cord is thus much, and then raise your hand away from it so that the artery does not burn, which is left, so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then dip the cord in salt water and place it on the spot, and leave it for three days; then dip the area at the edge slightly with oil, and let that one be cured with ointment so that it heals.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see this, cauterize the end of the knife according to cauterization and be careful not to cut the artery in this non-traditional emigre.
Capitol quart.	Fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cauterization for an ancient emigre.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an emigre with water described in the previous treatment and in the division of headaches, and if that treatment does not benefit, and sometimes because of the headache caused by water, which we have said to be treated with a scalpel cauterization so that it whitens, because it indicates on the area of pain according to its length from which the majority of it comes, or where it is; then pause your hand for a moment and tighten it within a strong constriction, and place the tip of a sharp knife on fire until it becomes white-hot, and then apply it to the affected area so that it burns.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuation of the jaw, which is moved during mastication, and that the tongue is not burned and the nerves are not damaged, and that it does not become spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and safety of the flow of blood from the artery that is being cut off, for in the cutting of it is fear, and more so when you do not know what water is used and you are not careful and attentive; then let the operation begin on the patient at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I come to the memory of the accident of blood flow from the artery according to his way, in his location of this freedom.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	If this headache does not benefit from that cauterization and the cord of the emigre is tolerable, then let that one be cauterized in the middle of the head according to what we have described, and cure the plague so that it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you see this, administer the cauterization which we have described in the head of stretching the artery with two knives, and this is the best cauterization and more so.
Capitol .v.	Fifth.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cauterization for ear pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to scratching and it does not benefit from the other treatment that we have described in the division of causes, then burn the cauterization, and this is the one which has no name, and this is its form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then place the tip of the knife or iron on the edge of the ear, and move it in a circular motion, or around the whole ear if the pain is there; or place it on one side of the ear and then move it to the other side if the pain is on that side.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Alonge them, little by little, the cauterization of the ear lobe, so as not to make him lose his balance by trying the place with a touch.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cauterization of the points is done on the entire ear lobe, and those are already healed, and the places are then cleaned so that they are healthy.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cauterization of torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture which is cured and has not to do with the spices that come through the blood, according to what we have said in the division of the maltitudes.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the spice which comes forth from drought or from a nerve spasm.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that kind of torture with jerrings and capipurgies and gargles, and do not confirm your cure, then three cauterizations are to be done: the first on the lobe of the ear, the second on a small piece of skin from the temple, and the third on the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause the small cauterization on the opposite side of the male malady, for softening does not happen except in that part which is healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the shape of the cauterization is that you cauterize it on the right side of the lobe of the ear, placing a small piece over the top of the head, and in the temple, which is according to the length of the said piece, and pause your hand so that the quantity of the spice of the blood comes out.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the shape of the cauterization, and it is special with the knife, the shape of which is placed in front of the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But even more careful is it that he put a little of the spice on the feet, and that he does not use too much useless grace.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then return the place to where it was before being cut, so that it is healthy.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you have said that you do not confirm your cure on the patient who has no fever, then four cauterizations are to be done: on all the hair of his head; and on the place where the pulse was before, as we have said; and in the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the way of doing the cauterization is done according to what has been said.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and then follow; and be cleaned with water that you have cut.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization of oblivion caused by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Then give the patient in the beginning jerrings big and pills with a strong voice.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then return the head of the patient completely, and place it on the neck of him with the paste described in the treatise of pastes.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Then pause some of them, for that is a way of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And put it according to that measure which I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And so if by those it is healthy; and otherwise, then do three cauterizations on the last part of his head, which are separated from the last part of the top within the last part of the head.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And between each cauterization the thickness of the spice, and return the cauterization with water that has been done.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	And if the patient is not thirsty and accepts water, then do the cauterization in the middle; and if you find that there is more addition, then cauterize it on both sides of the head.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then return the place to where it is healthy; and if the cauterization is olive according to what has been said before.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization of paralysis and softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Then you process in the softening of the head with jerrings and water that we have said; and return the head to the patient, and do the cauterization in the middle of the head, and on all sides of it, and on the last part of it, and on the two joints.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the softening of the body of three people and the patients are tolerant and the malady is strong, then cauterize it with four cauterizations on the joints of the legs, and afterwards return your hand so that the spice comes out by the blood.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then return the place to where it is healthy, and this be cauterization olive.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not cauterized to the epileptic one, but that epilepsy is caused by blood.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And then return the brain of him completely at the beginning, and with another cure that we have said in the division when the malady is great and the patient is tolerant of the experience of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not suffer the medicines, then administer gargles and mastication to him in front of water for three days, with a good flavor of food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then return the head of the child completely, and do the cauterization in the middle of the head according to the way that we have said before, and another on the top of him, and on each side of his head, and cauterize it on all sides.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the malady is strong and the patient is tolerant, then cauterize it with the ways that I have said, in having paralysis and softening of the body on the joints of the neck and the joints of the legs.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And do cauterization olive according to what has been said before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause the small cauterization according to this way.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humors and gross flame, then cauterize it with the ways that I have said in having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess of declining to melancholy, and the body of the patient is moist, then give him water that softens the brain according to the water that has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then return the head of the patient completely, and place it with a good way on the circle, and return that place to where it was before in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient be sixty years old, and is held completely.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then pause the linen; and it is more dignifying of a lamb's skin.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And bake it by fire with moderate heat, according to what it suffers when it is hot in the middle.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then return that place to where it was before on the circle of him, and leave it so that it is cooled down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And give the patient in a week once, by water that he has said to him; or if you wish, cauterize it with small points according to what we have said before, and this is the way of doing the cauterization which softens the brain with equality: this is the special cauterization that moistens the brain.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then return that place to where it was before in the color of a border or in the shades of yellow and green.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization of descending water in the vein.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have said that the beginning of water in the vein is declared by the senses that I have said in the division, then start and give to the patient water that softens his head, and preserve that from all humors.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And put this sweetener in a bath of milk for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to shave his head, and cauterize the spot where he will cut his hair; and cauterize twice on both temples if it is the beginning of a fever in two holes, or once on one temple if it is the beginning of water in a hole.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut all the veins and arterioles that remain with the blade, and let the cauterization be in the length in the latitude of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of flow of blood when he is cauterized; and if you see any flow of blood from him, stop it with some medicine, which is at your possible.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	Then come with wisdom that is in the extraction of arterioles and in the disappearance of those and the caution against flow of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some times he is cauterized in the neck with two bones pointed out by two cauterizations.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the Cauterization of Ancient Tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are old, flowing through the veins and arteries that go out to the manifest part of the head, and it is seen that they are superfluitatz, then cauterize with a knife what we have told in the chapter on the beginning of water, touching on the middle spot of the head, and on both temples, and on the neck between two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you feel a lack of addition, then cauterize on the whole length of the cheekbone on the edge of the brow with a small cauterization.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the Cauterization of the Odor of the Nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat the patient with water, which we have said in the division, and do not profit from your treatment, then prepare and give to him three cups of drink; and then shave his head, and cauterize with a half-moon shape.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize on the edge of the brow with a small clavus, with two cauterizations on both eyebrows, next to the hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the arceria that you do not set it on fire.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of the cauterization with a small clavus, this is the form:
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of Cauterization to Soften the Eyelids of the Eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or moisture, then cauterize it with a small cauterization in the shape of a moon; and this is the form of it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you want to, cauterize on both eyebrows a small amount with two cauterizations from end to end, and let them be extended from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	Let the length of each cauterization be according to the quantity of the brow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard on your hand with the cauterization, more according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is dried up.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of Cauterization to the Eyelid of the Eye When the Hair Turns White and the Hand Holds the Eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hair of the eye turns white in its inner part, so that it pokes the eye, then cauterize it according to two ways: either with fire or with burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If it is a cauterization of fire, command the patient to look forward, so that his hair does not burn, until it grows out and falls off; and if he holds his head with a cloth, then your hand should be above, so that the hair does not come into contact with the cloth.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then let the hair grow out and fall off, so that they are not caught; then place the patient's head in the third position, and put your hand on his brow with a signet, which is according to the shape of a fowl of death, and this is the beginning of the signet.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then put it in a bag of wool or in a paste of pigeons on the head.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then light the cauterization, and this is the form of it:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize according to the figure that you have drawn, little by little, until the surface of the hair is burned, so that it looks like a sheet of moss, completely burned.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The signet of health of the work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted, and the hair of the patient already lifted by the puncture of the head.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Then lift up your hand and place it on the bag for three days, and then open it and look at the content, that it may be well-made.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that with ointment, so that it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns because of the hair, then treat it again with fire first; and if it is returned because of the eyelid being softened, then treat it again with a cauterization, which we have said above.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hair is under the eyelid, then cauterize it until it rises to its natural place and is covered, so that the hair does not poke the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cauterization with burning medicine is this: command the patient to look forward, so that his hair does not burn, until it grows out and falls off; then let him hold a cloth over his head, and make a signet of a sheet of moss, which we have said above.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Then take a sharp knife, and remove the cause with a quick stroke. I. Mix those causes together, and make a paste of them, so that it is not dried up; then spread the paste on the cloth, which we have said above, with the shape of a sheet of moss, and place it on the patient' side; and put the patient' head in the third position, and open the hair.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Then place the medicine on it, and press it a little, so that the patient does not feel the taste of the medicine, because its taste is in fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Then when the patient perceives that the medicine has a bitter taste, then let him leave the medicine and take it again by the third side; then when the taste of fire or cutting stops, then wash the head with water; and then consider if the eyelid has been raised already, which is good, or if it has fallen back, which is bad; and if it has fallen back because the medicine has dried up, then your operation is ruined and the hair is damaged.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then put it on the bag for safety, so that the hair is not caught; then treat it with ointment of oil or water, so that it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And you must guard your operation with careful watchfulness, so that the medicine does not fall on the head; and if the eyelid is softened by any cause because of the hair, then treat it again with the medicine on the spot where the eyelid is softened, and as soon as it begins to work, then completely, until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of a sheet of moss.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	The eyes of men are different in size and shape; and therefore your compression should be according to each eye.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	Do not hide the path of the cure for him who studies this craft.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII. De la contraccio de les palpebres.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On cauterization of the fistula that is in the lacrimal canal of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat the fistula that is in the lacrimal canal of the eye, and do not refer to your own technique, then command the patient to hold his head still on top, and have a minister hold it from behind in such a way that he does not move or shake his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then apply some hot wax or a poultice made of wool on top of the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then light the cauterization, this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	The one that is curved, thus made of a cane or a stick of wood, from one end of which the cauterization is applied.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see, then let it penetrate to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish, then do so with difficulty.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the curved one is better for the work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press on the fistula if it is open, and draw out its liquid and dry it up.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then apply the cauterization that is well lit on top of the eye, and at the same time make a small cut in the corner of the eye, so that the hand or the patient does not move, and the cauterization is applied to the gray part of the eye and let it corrode.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And thus, if at the beginning of the eye cauterization it penetrates into the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cauterization once or twice, as needed, and leave it alone for three days, and then apply the ointment that is dried up around it so that it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	However, if after eleven days it is not healed, then apply the acute corrosive medicine inside so that the bone is uncovered and scrape it according to what your manual says in the patient's chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another way of treating a fistula, which some earlier writers said: Enter into the place of the fistula and cut it open, and then apply to that crack that is very small in shape: And pour in that quantity of molten lead; and let your hand be well held back, so that the lead does not reach the eye of the patient; and then apply hot wax on top of the patient' s eye where the fistula is, as the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it by a wonderful cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with water that we have mentioned in the cauterization and cure, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer trauma through the nose and reduce the fistula to its base according to what comes out in its place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of a wound with fire.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Moles that appear as cracks on the lips, and mostly on children' s lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	So, when you treat those cracks with water that we have mentioned in the divisions and do not apply your cure, then light the small knife according to this form that it burns:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	The cavity of the nose according to the subtility of a blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then return that knife with precision into those cracks so that the cauterization reaches the base of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with cerotine so that it heals.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or in the roots of the teeth there is an abscess that bursts, and then it is broken, and then it is pushed back, and then it is burned with fire, and your hand is applied to it, so that the burning fire reaches the base of the abscess, and then you treat it with water that we have mentioned in the cure, then apply hot wax on top of the abscess, and let it burn; and then, if there is any pus left, then light the fire a little more; and then treat it as mentioned above for healing.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the healing has taken place and it is healed, it is good; and if not, then uncover the place and burn the bone corrupted according to what your manual says in the patient' s chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are loose, then treat those with medicines and do not apply your own technique, then return the patient' s head to the top, and light the cauterization in the form that is mentioned above, and quickly insert it into the tooth; and let the heat of the fire reach the root of the tooth from below.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand, and repeat the cauterization a few times according to what you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then make the patient' s mouth drink saltwater and keep it for an hour, then rinse that out, as the loose tooth is stabilized and the softened gum is tightened and the corrupting moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by cold or heat, or it does not respond to your medicine, then apply any of the following two ways: cauterize at the root of the tooth with cow's milk or cauterize with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with border is that you take cow' s milk and heat it up, then apply that hot milk to the root of the tooth, and then wrap it in a cloth over the end of the tooth, and quickly dip the wrapped tooth into the heated milk, and let that hot milk cool down on top of the painful tooth until it is cooled down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Then repeat that application several times until the heat of fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see, then dip a hair or cloth into the heated border and apply it to the tooth, and then apply hot milk to that, and then let the heated border reach the base of the tooth' s cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the cauterization with fire is that you attend to the liquid of milk or iron, and that it is in the center of the tooth and the sharpness of fire does not reach the patient' s mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then light the cauterization in the form mentioned above, and then apply it to the tooth, and let your hand be well held back so that the cauterization does not reach the patient' s mouth; and then, if necessary, repeat it a few times, as the pain persists for some time.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	Then, because of the impression that that patient' s mouth takes from the hot border and is held for an hour, then rinse it out; and this is the form of the cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize at any extreme point that you can see.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the form of the tube:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of an exostosis.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When the exostosis is made of slimy fluid and viscous fluids that do not respond to medicines, and you see its digestion easily by the sight, then light the cauterization in a curved form as mentioned above; having two open ends, so that the smoke of fire reaches one end, and apply that smoke to the abscess once, and if you wish to, from another end; then let it cool down on top of the abscess until it stops burning.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	Here is the translation of the text:

Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter III.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the Cauterization of Wounds and Constriction of Arteries.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When the moisture comes over the chest of the patient, and mostly when the air is cold, then it should be made to evacuate the patient at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that place where the wound is located.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful not to cause the cauterization to reach the chest or to burn the patient's skin with the cauldron, but only a little bit."
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	"And then cauterize that other wound with another cauterizer starting from the base of the neck at the last vertebra."
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	The cauldron should be made in the way described above.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	"And then clean that wound that came before it until it heals."
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the Cauterization of Lung Malaise and Coughing.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When the cough and lung malady are caused by cold humors, and there is no fever or consumption, but it is an old disease, then cauterize that wound twice on the rib cage in the areas where it is located, and on the middle of the foot between two breasts; and the cauldron should be made in the way described above."
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	If you want, you can make your cauterization with a pointed instrument, the shape of which you apply to the point where the pain is in the ears."
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Make points within those areas, and then clean that wound that came before it until it heals."
