E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And you should know that when the blood flows from an artery, it is not possible to stop that blood, and even more so when the artery is large, unless in one of four ways: or by cauterizing as it is said here, or by extraction when it is not extracted, for when it is extracted the extremities of him are burned, and that blood is stopped up; or that it is tied with a cord or a ligature by a strong contraction, or that it is placed on medicines of which the virtue is to stop up that blood; and those are twisted with the palm towards the heart.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	However, that which is administered by a cord and by a restriction from him has a more painful effect, and one should be careful not to cause it.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	However, if this happens to someone and there is no present medicine or remedy, then open the hand at the orifice of that vein as it has been said here, and understand the great contraction of him within which the blood is stopped from its natural course, and on the artery let not the hand remain immobile; and upon the artery let fire be sprayed with a very cold spray so that the blood congeals and thickens; and also let fire be applied to where it needs to be cauterized or to medicine as necessity requires.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	On Incision, Puncture, Bleedings, and Plagues, and their Similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are words of Avicenna.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	I have already said in the first chapter all illness for which fire is appropriate and medicine, and its occasions and causes, and the instruments with which to make cauterizations; and these chapters of the subsidiary chapters are arranged under the heads within the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter according to that method, so that what is wanted may be found easily; then upon this that it should be sought.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	In advance of what I am about to say here, know, and understand that in this chapter it is for fear what is said in the first chapter of Cauterization; and that which is before me, and know that:
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And know that in this water which is here with great caution, for in the operation described in this chapter there are many wounds that are caused by the discharge from the vein or incision on the abscess or opening of an ulcer or extraction of an arrow or incision of the throat, and similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all these are accompanied by fear and trembling, and at their head is death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that upon you not this water should fall, for some wounds are caused by the manner of men's hands, and many similar diseases.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And some of them are caused by the nature of their illness, and it is quickly taken from him by this water which is violent, and by the length of his illness, and at the beginning of his illness he is afraid of that which causes his illness; and death follows him for long.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And some are those who give you hope and comfort, but their illness is destructive; and his illness is pernicious.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And then I do not agree that you consent to this manner of men towards you; and your caution should be greater than that which is avoided, and your haste should be less; and do not assume any cause against him except a certain knowledge which certifies that water is harmful for you, and as far as it concerns succession, it is blessed.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the treatment of all your illnesses by means of prediction and indication of him who is helpful in gaining fame and memory, in being praised and glorified.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Or children, God in you his understanding, and do not seek guidance or protection from him, for water is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have arranged this chapter according to the chapters which preceded it in the Cauterization Chapter, of the cure from the head to the feet, so that what you want may be found easily from what is before you, and from what you need.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the Cure of Water which is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	And you should know that this illness which appears in children is caused by the development and when the brain of the child is lightened.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	Some, however, are caused by a hidden cause which is not perceived.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I did not see this illness in children except; and all those whom I saw were dying, and for that reason it was shown to me a work which is done in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I saw that a child had its head filled with water, and that the child's head remained constantly wet until he could not stand it due to the size of his head, and more than the humidity made him sick so that the fire killed him.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity or is added between the heel and the shin, or it is added below the shin over the Achilles tendon.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For if the operation in that place is little humidity between the heel and the shin and pus there is none, then consider that you have to make a cut in your head's middle location on a fissure in length, and the length of the fissure is two fingers deep, and this is the shape of the sputum:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if humidity is increased more and pus is larger, then there are two fissures according to this method:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if humidity is left of the bone, it is an indication that you should make the corners of the head open completely and the water is pressed when you squeeze those from inside out and not up to your face.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Consider that you have made three cuts in the middle of the head according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And let the incision take out all humidity; and strengthen the fissures with gauze and cotton; and pour oil from above on it every fifth day, and then clean the wound and dress it with ointment and bandage, and strengthen the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little humidity so that the member is healed and cured.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another way of incision, which you consider according to the size of the pus and the accumulation of water, because some cuts are in the back of the head, or at the front, or on the right, or on the left; and therefore make the incision where the pus and the water accumulate, and pour it out according to what is most possible for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not incision the artery, and let the blood flow out from a wound of pain and cure the patient for this flow of blood to get rid of humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of incision of arteries that are close to the ears, called iliacs.
Capitol segon.	Chapter II:
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When there is a rupture in the lungs or feet, and it is old blood, and you do not give medication to it, then the last cure for this is incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore when you want to incision those who have a headache from the back of the head, and rub the area with coarse cloth so that the veins appear, and consider where the pulse is; and the places on each side of the ears are pinched, and hidden in some men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then strengthen the vein by trying, and incision each one with a sputum from the middle of each side by making an incision up to the bone, and let it be through the length of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want to, insert the sputum under the artery and turn it around so that the incision is on each side.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be two fingers' width, because when a vein is incised, it beats with a pulsating rhythm, which may stop because it is frequently beaten.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	More if the vein does not feel good to the touch, then consider that you measure the quantity of space between three fingers, and then try it, and cut it up to the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And this is the quantity of blood in one cup. and stronger blood does not give up so much or less, and this is according to the quantity that appears from the virtue of the patient and the accumulation of the vein.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And consider the pain, and if there is any cause in the Achilles tendon area, then incision it so that it does not cause pus.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And strengthen the pain with gauze and a drape bandage, and then clean that with ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III:
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of veins that are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When there is a headache from the left side or from the right side due to alcoholic or other causes, and it responds to medication, but you do not cure it, then we will turn to the extraction of veins in the temples or cauterization of those as if they were shown how to treat them.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of operation and extraction of those is that the patient rubs the hair in the temples because it is what is shown to him by his pulse; and the vein appears on the forehead because it is shown there by its movement, and it is hidden in a few men by its speed.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then the back of the patient should be strengthened with some cloth; and rub the area with a coarse cloth or evaporate the area with water until the vein appears clearly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then take the following sputum:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then take the heel with that ease until you reach the vein; and cut it from the sides separately until you extract the heel vein and uncover those of the shoes which are left there, completely.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	More if the artery is thin, then wrap it with the end of a finger, and incision one from the side according to the quantity by which the ends of the legs are stretched and contracted, and do not give up blood because if they are not incised, the blood will not rise from the feet.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then let the blood out of one cup. into three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the vein is large, then consider that you tie it in two places with strong thread or rope, and do not allow it to break before the healing of the pain, and give up blood from it in front of the consolidation of the pain.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then incision the surplus which is between two bands; and make it in that hour or another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want to, cauterize it with fire within the bone by cauterizing the ends of the legs, and keep that place where it has been cauterized.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better work than the patient has fever or it is a cold complex; for cauterization helps to end humidity, and therefore it is better in healing.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then consider the extraction of veins that are in the back of the head, and let them rest on a clean cloth, and then clean those with dry medications so that the flesh is healed and cured, and the blood is made clear.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you open another vein that comes out of the vein of blood from the arteria, then consider that you stop it by strengthening your hand until it stops bleeding; or cauterize it, or that you tie it up, and tighten your hand so that it stops bleeding.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if for any reason those are not with you, then pause the finger on that place until the pain stops hurting, and pour cold water on the wound until it stops aching, and strengthen it according to what is done.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And the time for blood to be extracted from a vein is that you cauterize the vein with two knives, because you have tied those two places together with a string, and pause each one, igniting it, until it reaches the bone, and incising the vein in two places, so that it is stretched between the ends of the legs, because they are not healed by that cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	Then it will be sharp on both sides.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But if there are less sharp points than two knives that fit each other properly, and do not cut the flesh quickly, then it is better.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Then with some thickness, the fire's heat is applied to it and the flesh is cut easily.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all works and less laborious.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	Then the space between two knives should be a measure of the thickness of the flesh.
Capitol quart.	I capitulate.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the treatment for sharp and acidic joint pain in the feet.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the painful joints are caused by acidic blood that comes out of those veins that come from the top of the head and do not cause any problem with the use of medicine, and sometimes the face of the patient becomes red and it feels like there is a crawling sensation in front of them, as if it were an itch, and their feet are tired, so their hair becomes coarse, and their eyelids are scarred by the sharpness of the tears, we will not use this treatment.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the servant to shave the hair that is on the patient's forehead, and make three cuts evenly spaced according to the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the cut falls on two fingers: the first cut is evenly spaced according to the length of the nose in the middle position of the forehead, and the second cut is according to the length of a little more than the movement of the eyelashes, and the third cut is on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And keep your hand away from the incisions that are two inches long, and extend your hand from the continuation of both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space between each incision is a measure of three fingers.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a thin sponge or dry cloth ready, with which to extract the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	Then return the two sharp ends together, and this is the form of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which begins at the first incision and finishes at the second one.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Then cut off all the tissue between those two incisions that is over the bone, and then make a smaller incision between it and the second one.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	Then use this sponge and insert it into the first incision, then another instrument that is called a knife, sharp on one side and blunt on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	Then lift up the jaw of that animal with your hand and bone behind it, and then cut it off at the neck so that it comes out through the small incision, and cut all the vessels that come from the head to the feet.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	Then continue the incision after the tendon has been cut, and then make another small incision between it and the other one.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	Then pour the blood that falls from a small quantity evenly spaced into the sponge that is under the incision.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then place a small knife blade in each crease, and place it over the dust that is mixed up with dirt, oil, and vinegar, and dip it into salt water.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	Then on the third day, cut off all the flesh and administer cold water, then treat the blood with basil-oil and other substances that make wounds heal.
Capitol .v.	I capitulate.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the treatment for hiccups by catharsis and when the pain is caused by something coming out of the mouth from inside the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When the hiccups are caused by catarrh and continue, and sometimes the feet of the patient become tired, and already their appearance improves, and their eyelids become scarred and their hair becomes coarse, and in the front of the head there is an acute pain that feels like it is burning and coming out, then you know for sure that these things are caused by something that comes out from inside the head through the mouth.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best treatment for this is: command the servant to shave the forehead, and make a small incision in the middle position (and start the incision of the left temple within the right temple; and cut off the bone that is covered with skin, and extend your hand from the tongue), then open it wide.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Then dry all the blood with a sponge or a dry cloth, and then fill the incision between the two lips with a small knife or a piece of cloth.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then dip it in dirty water mixed with oil to prevent the wound from bleeding.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	Then when the blood has stopped and the pustule has shrunk, then know that it is time to cut off the bone from where it begins, and then treat the flesh with a mixture of flour and water, and four parts of colophony, and make a paste out of it, and administer it to the affected areas.
Capitol .vi.	I capitulate.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the treatment for water that is caused in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Any cause of water in the ears is one of four kinds, because it is either mineral and causes similarity to lead and copper, or it is plant-like and similar to hazelnut and fava bean, or it is fluid and similar to water and vinegar, or some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	Then if lead or copper causes water in the ears, or if it is plant-like and similar to hazelnut and fava bean, then dip the ear on its own into oil of violets or sizami, and then treat with the extract, and make a sound like sneezing, and if there is a need for sneezing, then make the patient sneeze.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	Then place a few pieces of cloth or wool over the ear, and extend it upwards, because the movement of the wax is caused by this.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then if it is not caused by this, then treat with an extract of the plant called ghee, and make sure that you are treating the right ear. And this is the form of treatment:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is caused by gesticulation, then treat with half a teaspoon of ghee; otherwise, treat with one teaspoon of double-boiled ghee.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	Then if it is not caused by water, then make a tube of metal and insert the end into the ear canal and close it with wax and softened oil so that it does not come out easily but through the tube.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	Then remove it carefully with a small piece of wire that is tied to a strong cord, because three times have passed since we counted the water that we have mentioned.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	Then if it is not caused by this method, then hold a piece of string or a small cloth around the ear carefully, and place a little quantity, and pause it with your finger.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	Then return it into the ear with ease, then dry the ear with a cloth.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	Then if it is not caused by the causes that we have mentioned, then you are a doctor who treats hiccups and spasms.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way to cut it is that you command the servant to cut off the head of the blood vessel and extract it from the foot, and then make a small incision in the middle position, and turn the ear upside down, and dip it in water.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	Here is the translation of the text:
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	If the cause of the swelling is in the ear, which is caused by pus and infection, then administer the cure and extract it; but if you do not obey the doctor's orders, then take this subtle solution according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer to that person the removal of the pus which is in the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not pour water when you think that it is already moistened by the vapor of the ear, and put it in a bowl, and extract it with your nails or with a subtle tool, or cut off as much as possible, because it is easier to remove.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that enters the ear, the patient should use sneezing before starting, and fill his nose with cold water, and blow it out over that ear, and if by doing so there is a discharge, it is good; and otherwise, then take two or three fresh peens and cut them according to its length, and wrap those in fire slightly, and let the patient put one of those peens into his ear and jump on that part a little, and strike with another peen over the pein which enters the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	So that water does not come out until all the water has been discharged.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And already the water has been discharged, then take paper or a cotton wool ball, that is to say, and put one end of it in the ear and extend the other end towards the fire until it is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put another cotton wool ball and pour water as many times as needed until all the water has been discharged, and wrap it with a cane as much as necessary to remove it from the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of a beast that enters into that ear, if it is a small thing, then wrap it and remove it with a hook as we said above in the division; but if it is a big thing that causes pain to the whole head, then administer the extraction with nails and tools, and the cause of it is less serious than all other causes that enter into the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of a vermen that is born in the ear, when you cure that with water as we said above and in the distillation treatise, and if you do not have confidence in your cure, then look at the ear towards the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if there is any cause of the vermen, then extract it with a subtle tool or a nail, but if there is no cause, then take a long and wide cane as described above in the form of it.
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the thin end into the ear according to the quantity that the patient suffers, and then suck it with a strong suction, and pour water as many times as needed until all the worms have been discharged.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if you do not obey the doctor's orders, then wrap it and close it up in the cane with wax as we said above; then administer distillation that has already been prepared for the treatment of worms, and look at water in the distillation treatise.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And be your infusion with which you pour the medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument, of which this is the form of it:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	Make it of silver or brass, narrow, and on one end, there is a small hole, and above it.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And then wrap it with a tape that covers the opening of the cane where it is necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take a thread and wrap it around the end of it nicely with a knot, and then pour oil into the cavity of the ear, or some juice of any herb, or water that you want from these medicines in the cane – and that is in the ear –, and then insert the thread into the cavity and squeeze your hand to expel the oil into the cavity of the ear and the patient will feel it inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And water that is poured into the ear has already been burned slightly by fire.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful that the cause that you will extract from the ear is not too strong, because the ear medicines do not tolerate water well.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of Treatment of Ear Aching.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some small children of old men are not pierced, and water has already occurred in some adults, causing pain in the middle part of the ear due to disease or meat, and this pain sometimes occurs at the entrance of the ear, and sometimes it is in the splits.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	That which occurs in the middle part of the ear, which does not understand the cause, is in difficult treatment.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that which you can understand the cause, be careful to pause the patient' ear towards the sun and look at it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	But if there is a lot of pain, open that with a subtle opening tool, which is described in this form:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the end of it is small in size, and one part is sharp and the other is not; and the blade is two or three nails long so that it does not cut the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	But if the aching is caused by hidden meat in the ear or in the middle part of it, then extract it with subtle nails and cut it with a sharp cutting tool quickly so that all the meat is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	If the aching is in the entrance of the ear, then take a sharp, subtle tool and burn it slightly, and then put that in the middle part of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	But if the patient feels pain with water that he drinks and is not able to hear well, then try to press it easily; and be careful not to injure the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then pause the ear with wax according to the width of the cane that you have wrapped in Egyptian balm; and pour water a little at a time over it until you are sure of the consolidation of the ache; or take some herbs and crush them, and sprinkle them on it, and use it; and if the ear is already infected, then be careful to destroy the herb and replace it with another that is made with rose oil, so that the infection eases; and then cure that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if there is a lot of pain, then dip a sponge or cloth in water and press it against the ear, and use the other treatment that we said in the distillation treatise to stop the pain, which is called:
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of Treatment of Achesil, Which Enters Between the Eyebrows.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	That which enters between the eyebrows of the person sometimes is wet, and sometimes it is dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	And if you have those with a high temperature or with nails, cut them into pieces with a sharp blade and then pause them on the affected areas.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if there is pain due to a lot of blood flowing, then you will cauterize those with a subtle, sharp knife.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is done with sharp knives and the blood flowing out is stopped when there remains any cause of bleeding; and when cauterized with fire, those bleeding are burned up and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter .ix.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment for blindness that comes to the eyelids of the eyes:
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Blinding pain that comes to the eyelids of the eyes due to some cause which is combined with blindness and toughness, and for this reason it is called blindness.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	It is an addition of thick moisture on the inner eyelid, and above and below it.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Then the treatment is that you should consider if the blindness comes from above and below it, which is different from the pain on the eyelid, and the cause of it is unknown.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then open that with a sharp knife from top to bottom, and remove it easily if it comes out, and cut off that which is attached to the other by means of a thread, and
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not equipped for this operation, do not put it off until the pain has passed without any cause; and when the pain passes, then perform the operation.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the case is serious, then you should adjust it with a stitch; and treat that which has been injured so that it may heal.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is little, you will not suffer much from that pain, for the blood of it restores and heals it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the blindness is declining towards the inner part of the eyelid, then remove the eyelid and cut off the blindness with a thread so that you do not suffer from the operation, and press that which is on all sides; and if the eyelid, by means of a cut, is drawn out, then there is no cause for worry.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	Then open that with water, and clean the eyes well; and treat the area with fire so that it may be healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter.x.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of treatment for blindness in the eyelid above the eye:
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axe-injury is what happens in the skin of the eyelid above the eye, and most often affects children, causing them to weep a lot because they cannot see clearly.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And because of this, you often see things in a blurred way, and they sleep a lot; and on the inner eyelids there are moist hairs that already cover the swelling with air, and the appearance of a lump is visible when you press it with your fingers; and when you touch those hairs, you can feel the sensation of fire within them.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	There is a way to operate on that which the patient holds his head in his hand and presses it down with a cloth, and makes five cuts there, and from those five circles a part is cut off, and that circle is placed above that which has been injured so that fire can be applied to it; and then place it on the middle of the circle, and open that humidity which has collected there by pressing it with your fingers so that it may become solid again, and then open that which was closed by means of a cut from top to bottom, and the cut should not be bigger than the one that is made in flaubotomia.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the case of a cold injury, you should cut off all the skin so that you can reach fire; for in the different positions of the body the fire is applied by means of a crack according to the shape of white snow.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then take it off with the clothes that you have wrapped between your fingers, and turn it over from one side to the other while holding it in the middle so that it is completely cut off.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And remember not to press the crack too hard so that fire does not reach the eyelid and burn it;
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if fire does not appear at the beginning of the crack, rather than pressing it, you should place a small piece of cloth on the inside so that it may produce fire; and then remove it as we have said; and then dip the cloth in water and clean it with ashes, and place it over the area and press it with your fingers.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	Then sprinkle salt on it and place it in the cavity of the crack so that the moisture that has collected there is removed.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that which has been injured so that it may heal.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if it is a sudden injury with swelling, then treat that with a poultice so that it may heal.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter.xi.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of methods for testing the eye:
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the eyelids of the eyes become swollen and irritated by the adjustment of the natural hairs, then test the eye with fire, or with sharp knives and threads so that the lid is opened and closed again, and this is called "tactininir" of the eye, and it is cured in four ways: either by fire cauterization; or with acute medicine as it has been said in the chapter on cauterization; or with a knife according to the direction of the eyes; or with straws, depending on whether they look straight.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And then place the head of the patient on your right hand; and turn the eyelid of the eye towards you with your left hand, and if it turns, it is good; and if not, put a needle into that which is faithful to the crack near the lid, and make the needle penetrate into that which is faithful from above, and it should be— close to the edge of the eyelid where there are no hairs — close to the hairs, and pull the thread through the lid, and turn it towards yourself.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	Then open that which is inside the eyelid near the hairs with a needle and thread so that it may reach the lacrimal major from above the lacrimal minor; then remove the thread and place it on the eyelid with small pieces of cloth or cloth, and press it with your fingers to check whether there is fire on the eyelid; and if there is such a figure as a crescent moon.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But in any case, remember that the figure should be different according to the amount of swelling on the eyelid, because fire has been discovered among people, because those who have suffered from blindness do not admit that the eyelid has swelled to a certain degree.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	Then open that on the two lines you have marked, and begin from the lacrimal major towards the lacrimal minor.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your crack is close to the natural hairs in such a way that it is the width of a king's finger.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	Then place a piece of gold in one of the two corners of the cloth, and remove it completely, and adjust with a thread that is very thin between the two lips with yarn or fine wool, and wipe off the fat from the thread, and make it adhere to the hair above the eyebrows by means of a certain substance if you wish to do so, and if not, do not worry about it.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	Then leave the stitch between three or four days, and then treat that which has been injured.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, leave the wound without suturing, and treat that which has been injured with fire so that it dries up and hardens, because the eyelid becomes swollen by means of a seal when there is swelling; but it is better to stitch it up well. And therefore say that the ancient methods of treatment are good.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But in any case, it should be sought out on the patient, and it is a good operation, and it is not feared.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And another way of treatment is that you see on the eyelid such a figure as a crescent moon, and then raise the eyelid with three separate and close needles according to this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if that is not possible, use a needle, and if it does not close, take another needle with thread on the middle of the figure, and turn one end of the thread towards the lacrimal major, and the other end towards the lacrimal minor, and adjust the threads between your fingers so that they are equal, and then lift them up with a slight elevation towards the edge where it is open, lift all the cloth from that which has been injured by means of a slight elevation.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then he adjusts the two lips of the wound with a stitch, and he heals that part which should be healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	If however an abcess develops on your incisions or fissures, then treat that abcess with a poultice and a dressing.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And some times the eyelids themselves are turned inward so that you have to use an incision for them - a stitch is enough for this.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	To cut off hair from the face in the form of a mustache or beard:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And you make two little needles or tweezers from the thread, the length of which should be according to the width of the eyelid, and the thickness of it according to the thickness of the eyebrow.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	You have already cut into the ends of all fractures, where you have the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then add a little more of the thread to those ends which are too long from the eyelid of the eye, and tighten the needles on all sides with a sharp instrument, leaving one for several days; because if it is cut off by itself, it will rot and putrefy inside and go bad.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if the time passes on, then break the thread with a twine, and then heal that wound which should be healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	So when it is firm, the eyelid rises and does not prick.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is how to make two little needles according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and have the quantity of length and width neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of the raising of hair on the face with a hook when the hair is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the hair is not natural, hard and sharp on the face, then perform the operation in the following way: take a very small hook, pause it on that thread which is subtle and soft and lean, and then adjust the ends of it with a needle in a subtle manner.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And be the length of the threads of a palm's quantity.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	Then you continue with another subtle thread under it, and pierce the ends of it if you want to.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	Then place the patient's head with his face toward the sun, so that your work is visible, because it is a subtle and small operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	Then he inserts the hook into the hair root with care, and makes it enter quickly into the eyelid from the hair that has grown out of the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	Then pull the hair out from under it and make it enter into the eye, and the hairs be one or two or three, not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	Then pull your hand from that place where the hair has grown out of the natural hair on the eyelid with the hair still attached.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is pulled out of the eye and not taken from the hair, then you pull it out of the ends with a thread that you have tied to it from that place, where it has been removed from the eye.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And then he will have good vision of the eye because you remove it from the place and tie it with a thread; so that each end is clamped down on it, and he leaves it for two or three days, within which time the hair adheres to its place and grows out from there.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the hair is too long, then adjust a long thread from the natural hair; and raise it up to that place or, what you leave, so that its length is increased by a little space, and then you raise it.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the treatment of a bump on the eyelid above.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When there is a bump on the eye lid and it is hard, and it is drawn down from its place to the right or left part by bad consolidation of a wound or section or cauterization, and that is called leporine; and this either occurs naturally or accidentally, and is made by consolidation of a wound or section or cauterization, or by resembling them in an unfortunate way.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	And the way to operate on it is that you cut off that consolidation and separate the lips of it, and pause them in between which is a strip of cloth from linen, and tie them together so that they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And you do not use any cure for it from the causes which cause it to dry up or become hard; because if you make water return to it, it will become even harder than before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	And use that which softens it: such as fenugrec, and immerse in water from which the herbs are high and salt of the sea; or brew a little oil, and dip in it the strip, and heal with it.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the treasure of your cure is that you perform all operations except those which are hard at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have described is nothing else than a correction of a bump that does not return to its form before it begins.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the treatment of a bump on the eyelid below.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This bump, which is treated on the eyelid below, which is called a "vertable" bump, and is either natural or accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	And if it is made accidentally by a wound or section or cauterization or similar causes.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way to operate on it is that you take a hook with a double thread, and pass it under the eye from the tear duct on the left side into the tear duct on the right side, so that the thread reaches both ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	Then stretch the flesh from its ends with the hook and cut it with the knife, and then you incise it with a wide knife.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	Then if it returns to its form as it was before; and no, then you take the thread and place it in the split of the eyelid, and then you turn the eyelids to their places, and make two splits in the middle of the eyelid below.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	Then the ends of the two splits in the middle of the eyelid below are made at different angles to the incision which meets them, and when their angles come together, it forms a figure.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this shape is the Greek letter: Omega.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	Then stretch the flesh out with the same quantity that is the width of it on each side of it, and hold it so that it does not close the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	Then he adjusts the separate parts and sews them with a wool thread; then he heals those with a soft medicine and water in which they have been soaked, so that they are healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	If the bump is treated by a split or stitch or cauterization, then know that you should make a flat split on the hair of the eyelid according to what precedes it.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	Then separate the two ends with a sharp instrument as we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the summary of the speech on the treatment of a bump which is above or below, and carry out the operation, according to how it is prepared as a bump, and that is in a form of different shapes.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the skilled person knows how to prepare himself at all times in such a way that it does not return to its natural form, or comes close to it, and prepares it according to what is required for the operation and the instruments which are most useful.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation occurs in certain individuals so that the eyelid is firmly joined to the white of the eye, and interferes with its natural movement; then know that you should not meddle with the extremity of the ray below the eyelid, and raise it up or extend it outward from between those two parts.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you should cut the adhesion with a fine scalpel, which is not sharp in the incisions, keeping it obtuse so that the patient does not worry about the operation, and leaving the scalpel dull so that it does not harm the skin with its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	Then your incision should easily remove that adhesion, returning the eyelid according to its natural form and healing all of the adhesion.

E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate the eyelid from the eye with calamine, and place it on the eye with lanolin infused with aloe, and after three days use curative agents within that is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	On Eye Incisions and the Prominence of the Facial Bones of the Eyelids.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	You know that the eyelid is according to two manners, because it is either nervous, and is similar to hard cypher subtle; or it is not nervous, like white frozen moisture, which when it is touched, it must be forced out with an edge, and the edge is cut off, and the edge does not remain.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both spices do not begin until after the lacrimal gland, which runs little by little to cover the vision and prevent light from moving the eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	May the manner of working in this incision is that the patient keeps his head on his back, and opens his eyelids, and raises the eyelid to your hand, and collects the eyelid with a few double folds, and extends it to the corners thereof.

And then take a needle and insert it into that hair of horse or cow or milk, or of similar things, or of strong yarn, and double the end of the needle little by little and fix it in the middle of the eyelid, and pierce it with the needle, and fasten it to the yarn; and extend it to the corners thereof, and cut off that hair from the eyelid which covers the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And then you should follow that hair inside until the back of it.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you should cut the root of the eyelid with a fine scalpel or small scissors, and let the flesh of the natural eyelid remain so that by cutting it, there is not continuous flow of tears.
