Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	Shape of an unsharpened awl with two spines:
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	Shape of pliers which are closed on the part that has to be cut, and whose ends are marked and contoured:
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	Shape of a chisel with two ends from which the top is separated:
Forma de dos espatums latz:	Shape of two wide chisels:
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All these instruments are used, and when the medicine is less or more of those, depending on the patient's condition, it is necessary that the doctor prepare it well, and when it is given to the sick person, it should be in a good way, and the men who give it must be qualified.
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And do not open these instruments again once they are prepared, because the necessity of those is not excusable.
De extraccio de la segondina.	Of extraction of the second one.
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the second one is held back, it should be commanded to the mother that she retain her child in her lap, and if it sneezes, it is good.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And if not, then take a drop and pierce the cover with it, and place it in the mother's mouth, pressing and rubbing and anointing with chamomile and sage, and adding Arabic and cassia and holy wood.
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All these herbs or some of them are submerged in water in the drop, and place it over the fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	Then return a cannula of chamomile to the mother' mouth, and hold it so that the vapor comes out into the cavity of the mother.
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	Then return to make her sneeze, and the second one is also forgotten with speed.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	If it remains, then return this purification to the mother's mouth with water or salt water, and if she does not sneeze again, then place her other hand over the one that has been used, and when the second sneezes, then remove this hand. If it is difficult, then return to make her sneeze, and if it is not possible, then return to the mother's purification with oil or salt water, and if she does not sneeze again, then return to the second one.
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	Then leave that it is turned around right and left easily.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	And then return to adjust the quantity of attraction, because she will obey and avoid adhesion.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	And if the mother' mouth is closed, we have already described the purification with sneezing and the medicine of the drop with herbs.
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	If not forgotten with all the causes that we have described, then you should remember to do this again in the abstraction of the mother' mouth, but if it is not possible, and if it sneezes, you can prepare it by adding a little vinegar and salt, because this will cause her to sneeze.
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	But if it is prepared, it has a bad smell to the head and the stomach, and then return to the mother' mouth; and if not possible, return to administer it with smoke and appropriately to water.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	Some of the Ancients have already prepared this purification by smoking with tobacco and dried fig trees.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	Shape of an instrument that is used to smoke the mother according to the retention of blood and the second one:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	Be made of vinegar or of oil.
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	Then return the small end to the cavity and the wide one over the fire, and make the smoking over the fire' braids.
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And hold it so that it is consumed by this smoking, and repeat.
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	Of purification of the bottom of the non-pierced child.
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	Make an incision at the bottom of the child' behind, which is not pierced, and then prepare with subtlety and precision.
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	Then return to the mother that she pierce her child with this, and if not, then pierce it with an awl, and check so as not to touch the blood.
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	Then return to that it is covered with smoke of wine and oil; and prepare this one with vinegar within which it is relaxed.
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	If you fear that it will be burned, then return to pierce with a small knife, and if it is not possible, prepare it in the smoke of wine as described above. If the child wants to urinate, cover it with a towel.
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	And the burning of the bottom is due to the consolidation of plague or pustule; if this consolidation is carved out, then return to wash with water that we have described in purification and bloodletting.
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	Of purification of the fistulas that we leave.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	The fistula that we leave in the separation of parts is covered with a knot and its roughness according to the distance from the bottom or in the space between the two parts.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is a fistula or a wound.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	With this knot, the wetness that comes out is white or mild, and some of these fistulas are piercing.
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And these piercing ones are known by the exit of water and by wind; and some have used the exit of wine, and it is difficult to get out of those that come out quickly.
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	And some of these fistulas are located in the space that enters the bladder, and inside the neck of the urethra; and some enter the space between the hips and the pubic bone.
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And with water in which the piercing fistula enters the bottom and not, it is because you put the child' mouth into the bottom, and return to try a little oil or iron into the fistula when it is not painful.
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	If this is painful, then return to try a little iron or hair of a horse into the fistula when you feel the pain or the hair on the child' mouth.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel this or the hair in the mouth, and if it does not come out with the hook, then you will know that it is not piercing; then return to purification.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula enters the bladder or the neck of the urethra, the meaning is clear that it is urine; and the prohibition is that the location be treated with medicine to consolidate.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	If it is piercing into the space between the hips or the bone and causing pain in the loop of the hip, then the meaning is clear that it hurts here if it enters the bone, and hurting the loop; and that it is burnt there from time to time; and that this purification does not work with oil and does not consolidate.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all those tubes penetrating into it there is no cure of any kind, and the cure of them is labour and futility of the medical practitioners who deal with them, over which they are shut up.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in that which does not penetrate and does not old there is expected the cure according to what you have told me, and what I have already heard and tried.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And it is that the patient lies between your two legs and raises his legs inside them, the cushions are inclined towards his belly, and then introduce the probe into the fistula, or iron if it is in the small of the back, into the spot where you feel pain, so that you know where the probe enters.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if he feels pain in his lower back when the patient lies down, then cover yourself so that you do not get hurt when the probe enters the anus.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel the probe enter the anus when it is already inside you, or feel pain between your legs and that part of the body, then certainly it enters; so do not try to treat that one, for there is no cure for it, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	But they say that it cures in some men.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And of the cure by which health is expected in him, that you use subtle cauterization according to the width of the fistula, thus: before doing it, introduce that same cauterization into the fistula until it enters through his anus; and then repeat it two or three times, until you know that all those adjusted fistula tissues, which are like feathers of an ash tree, have been burned.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And that one is cured with bandages wrapped around it, until all those tissues which are joined together are burned; and if it is healed with medicines that give birth to and strengthen flesh, then it is well; and if not, then it is not cured by any other cure.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the probe enters and does not penetrate into the anus, between which and the probe there is a small piece of flesh or a fistula, and sometimes the fistula extends to where the skin is cut; then dry the skin from the beginning of the fistula, and you will see if the skin dries up completely with the probe; and if the fistula has been cut all the way through, then the probe is freed and passed; but if it has not been cut all the way through, then the probe goes no further.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	Then wash those fistula tissues which are joined together like a tube of ash, and do not let them be ripped by any other cause.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	But if blood comes out repeatedly between you and your work when you open those tissues, then the instrument which is used to stop it, whether it be with fire or with acute medicine, for fire cauterization does well in two things: it joins together those flesh tissues very well; and it stops any flow of blood from them by drying them up completely.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And that one is cured with bandages wrapped around it or with a three-pronged instrument, until the spot gets better; and then cure the gout with hot medicine that gives birth to and strengthens flesh,
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	and then treat it with medicines that make it tighten and stop bleeding; and when this has been done, then she is well and there is no fear of recurrence.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula has already entered through his anus and is long in length from its surface, then introduce the probe into his anus and feel it.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And if the probe goes in and is only skin or flesh between you and it, then it is near penetration; and there is no operation for him except by a trusted and hopeful method.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	The cause is to administer it in him one of three ways: either to cauterize it as we have said; or to dry it out completely within its cavity so that you can easily enter the probe into it and then cure it; or to lengthen it slightly with a sharp instrument, and then cure it; but do not cut it open because it will not heal; and if it leaks pus, then open the fistula at the opening of his anus, and clean out those foul-smelling secretions through his buttocks; and if the orifice does not get better and remains open, then open the fistula in the part of his anus from which he passes stool; but use cauterization to stop any bleeding.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes the fistula ends in this way: when you introduce the probe into the fistula, and it is in the part of his anus close to its surface and on the edge of his buttocks, then take care not to pierce it with a sharp instrument, for this is how you prepare the skin before piercing it;
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and then put a thin bandage around it, or wrap it in it; and then introduce the probe into that same bandage, wrapped tightly around it, and then cure it; and if you cannot reach the inner cavity of his anus with the probe, then use a sharp instrument to open it.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	But if it penetrates into his anus towards the back, then you pull out that same bandage from there and then introduce the probe into his anus; and when you pull out one end of the bandage, then make sure to wrap both ends tightly around its other end so that they do not slip; and when you pull it out, let it rest for a day or two, and then if you put it on the flesh, it will stick to where those tissues are joined together, which are between the two ends of the bandage.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And that is how the disease is cured when it is healed and well.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	But if the opening of the fistula does not penetrate, then make it do so in some way, whether by cauterization or by piercing it, for you must pierce it so that you do not hurt yourself; and then cure it.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of the probe that is curved: its curve is sharp and the other end is not, so that you do not hurt yourself; and this is how it is done when it needs to be done.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	Of stitches for hemorrhoids where blood flows in the opening of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are like two things: either they are between the buttocks and look like charcoal, or those are with grass-like hair.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And those are small and large, and the blood from them flows together; and it is only in one place, and on its edges.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	But those that are in the part of the buttocks are according to two things: either there is little moisture in them, from which blood flows as yellow water or a little blood in one place; and according to the colour of the skin.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the cure for those inside his anus is that you order him to lie down, and to squeeze himself so that the hemorrhoids appear.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you cut off and hang them by nails or what you have; and then you pierdes those with your fingernails.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	But if those claws are not on them because of their moisture and softener; then take them by the sharp points, and remove those with a sharp object or a knife, and feel them where they join; and then cut off those with your nails, and then dry them up completely.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And that one is cured with the other cure, so that they are well.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the buttocks do not obey in leaving: then order the patient to lie down on his back, and to wash himself with that water which is in the anus, and that water will help him to leave easily; and then use a sharp instrument to cut through those.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	If the hemorrhoids are pushing out from behind, then the cause is itching, and it is because you are rubbing them with your fingernail, or with an uncut nail, and scratching them, and then treating them with water that has already been used to clean something dirty so that they are cured.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And whoever wants to do the incision, follow this method: take a thread and wind it around two needles, and insert those into the hole, and remove the hemorrhoids from above, and make the other end of the thread come out over the hole, and horizontally; then tighten the hemorrhoid by stretching firmly, and then remove the thread and needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	Do this to everyone, and leave one of them uncut, so that the excess blood from the body runs out from there.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	Then place a cloth over the buttocks soaked in rose water or wax; and place that on the patient's buttocks, and order the servant to pause.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then let that person sit in a box; and when it is wet, treat those with oil or another treatment until they are healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	Of treatments for fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Vapor-like marks appear due to drying out of a wound or natural contraction.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And since those old medicines are not effective for them, if you scratch them with a spithook or your fingernail so that they become wet and are drenched in the fluid above them, which prevents their consolidation, then treat those that have consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you should cut them off with a sharp tool so that the first hole, due to itching, becomes an ulcer, and treat those that have already healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	Of treatment for alamismire, it is finished.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	Know that alamismire is finished, and it is only if the skin takes on a color resembling a clove's head, and it affects the whole body, especially the feet and the toes, and because of them the pain should be directed upward.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then you should know that it is cut where it is in the path of the claw, and if it is cut with scissors or an uncut nail, and then remove it from its root; and treat that one.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you want, cauterize the second one that precedes in the line of the claw's head.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	The common warts is a small, sharp, ulcerated, round spot on the surface of the body, and vapor-like marks appear in most children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	The treatment for them is to spread it and scratch it, or to stretch it with a thread inside where the box is.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you want, cauterize it, according to what we have said, with fire or acute medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And they are completely eradicated forward and backward using the instrument that I directed you to use.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	The common warts is a small, thick, ulcerated, round spot on the surface of the body that sometimes itches, and when the warts touch each other, they cause a pain resembling a bee sting.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	The treatment for them is to take a pen-like tube, and make it strong, and place that over the warts where it holds them in the circle of the pen's tip, and then turn your hand around the tube, so that you remove the warts from their root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, do this using an iron or lead tube according to this shape:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	It is important that the tip of the tube is sharp and silent (if not piercing), wrapped so that the liquid inside it does not come out, and then turn it.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you want, cauterize the warts according to what we have said before in the cauterization of athyr in the line of cauterization.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	Of the form of the instruments that are administered to give medicine.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Some marks are made of silver or lead or melted wax, and some marks are made of small instruments, because the instrument used for treating small children should be small; and that of the instrument used for treating adults is large, and those marks are small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The shape of the treatment mark is large and small:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The end of the tube above where the bag is attached should be wide according to this method; and it should be distinct from that place where the bag is attached, because sometimes it is wide and sometimes not.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the far end of the tube, which goes into the buttocks, should be silent  (if not piercing), turning from the side, and having two cuts, and on the other side one cut, and the width of the cut should vary according to the thickness of the rays and be wider on the small.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the bag in which the medicines are held should be of a bladder or sheep's wool, and its stem should be a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be pierced by two cuts like this when it is turned over, and if the space between the cuts is large, then the tip is wide.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then you should insert it into the cuts of a strong thread, which should be made of fine cotton, and adjust the bag to it; and when it is placed on the patient' head, let it be tight in the cap of the mark between two strong constrictions, and then mark each cut: The quality of marking them is that you fill the bag with medicine, which has been heated according to the tolerance of the patient; and be careful not to make it too long or too short.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then the patient should be laid on his back, and his legs lifted up so that they are under two pillows or a mattress; and apply the tip of the cauterizer to oil or white of egg or mucilage of fenugrec or something similar; and insert it into the buttocks with ease, and the minister takes the bag and squeezes it with two hands and expresses it with force so that it flows into the crucible in which the treatment is being made; and then remove the treatment and the patient lifts his legs from the mattress.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces him to sneeze, hold back as much as you can; and if he sleeps for a whole night, it is better to wait until the next day.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	If you treat them with medicines that relieve gas in the stomach and sneeze, then you should repeat the treatment if they still sneeze after using those medicines.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the buttocks there are hemorrhoids or painful swelling, then it is the treatment mark being small and silent, according to those marks with which children are treated.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Of treatment for plagues.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already said and explained in the division of the treatment for plague which medicine is suitable, and I will explain that again as follows:
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Thus, the plague differs according to where it is caused and according to the place where the infection takes place.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	The causes of the plague are different according to whether it is caused by a person's behavior (such as drinking or eating contaminated food), cutting with a knife, hitting with a lance, a spear, or similar to those who cause wounds.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	And the plagues that are in a person' body are different according to whether it is caused by a plague on the head, or the neck, or the feet, or the stomach, or the arms, and similar to those who affect members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I recommend the treatment of some diseases so that this reasoning stops and takes place on other diseases.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with simple headaches, because the memory of the composition will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Then say that when it happens in the head simple headache and is not fracture, consider: if it is by thinking of water or of appearance, and has already trinquada the nose so only and is a great pain and you are afraid about this patient will have an apostema cauterization, then you get up and do cauterize the head with wine so much, and do not delay there; and extract it to that person according to the quantity of its virtue if no more cause prohibits cauterization, mostly if the headache is caused by a headache from little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And it is cauterization of the opposite of the diseased part; and protect that patient from repletive things, from food and from thick foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if by the minimization there is some prohibition, then it is lessened by food and do not bring it close to meat or drink.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And pause on the disease, if to him happens apostema cauterization, then pour pure oil or wine in which is styptic.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if it is safe from cauterization, then pause on the disease, if it is recent am its third day and the air has not changed that powder which I recommend to put there small.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that powder, then pause on a wound with wine until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the disease is big or it is by cutting of space and of appearance, and their lips are not closed with sutures, then adjust those according to what I recommend for the suturing of them.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the disease has already been discovered from the bone and it is not repressed but only a small suspension, then cut off that one and cure the disease with medicines and restore the flesh to its place instead of the nose, and order for this patient that he eat food in which there are gross things: cheese and bread and butter, or whatever is available.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if there is putrefaction in the nose and it does not stick to the bone, then you cut off all of it and pour it out, and then cure it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these diseases there is an artery or a vein from which blood can flow from the disease and it is not cut off by medicines, then you inquire about that artery, and if it has been cut off, then cut it off with a blade, or stick it; and if necessity forces you so that what we have said does not suit you, then cauterize it so that the disease be cut off.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these diseases are simple and small, the cause of them is dry; so that you sprinkle on those powder, because when consolidated that one before the air has changed it.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the way of that powder is this: take a part of oil from a tree, two parts of dragon's blood, three parts for an unknown cause; all mixed together and well shaken, and if there is disease filled with blood, and it is confined by good constriction until it sticks to it, then it is coagulated with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then put that powder on it and leave it alone, and do not take it off until it is healed, because it will not become apostemic, since it has not been treated with medicine.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	But once in a while, water only, when it is not at your side in the presence of oil and dragon' s blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this operation is done in the big diseases when it is convenient that they be paused on those and well-closed, and only recent diseases whose air has not changed them.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has changed them, especially in summer, then it is not convenient to put this powder on them, but rather cure them with water that we have said, or rather pause on them with wet garlic juice or with flour of wheat mixed with water and honey until they are healed; and then cure them with other treatment until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if it happens in the fracture of a bone, and it is small, then you extract water with gestures.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I direct the treatment for fractures of the head with poison.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the diseases of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the disease happens in the neck, then it is not difficult to distinguish from the treatment of a simple headache.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves of the neck are cut or an artery, then if it is a nerve, it is not in its place but is avoided treatment with water that causes severe constriction, so as to avoid injury and pain because it affects the nerves and hurts them.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And you do not pause on the disease for any reason, because the substance of nerves is red and the continuation of them is to the skull, which is the pus of all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	But if water is used for treatment with herbal medicines, so that it is washed in double water, a drop of red oil or not red, and a drop of minora when it is washed with double water and the other remedies are minora according to this way, and dip it in water.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the disease is big, then administer sutures or clamp the lips together, and then cure it with powder until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the disease has depth or happens in the lowest part of the pus, then pierce that one in the place most affected.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if the disease has already been cut off and there is a flow of blood from it, then separate or dry that one, or stick it together, or cauterize it if necessity forces you to water.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the vertebrae of the neck have been cut off completely and only the veins of the neck are left, then you adjust the lips of the nose with sutures on the top of the jawbone and do not touch that one; then reduce that one to its natural figure, and tighten it with a good constriction, and leave it alone; and then cure it with wet garlic juice in which there is stinging and excitement until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the disease has been done in the bone with injury, then strike that one, and if there are fragments of bones, extract them all; and if it is not covered by a covering, leave it alone until the disease is healed, and separate and clean its edges so that they do not hurt each other.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the disease is recent, then sprinkle on it the powder which I have recommended for you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if the disease has been done with a fistula, then cure it with water from which the memory of composition will come in the third chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the diseases of the neck or of appearance when they happen between the shoulders and are done with a space, or with a knife, or with a lance, or with appearance.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a cut of a knife or a lance, and it has depth, then consider whether the patient is gasping or not; you should know that the disease is dangerous.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	But if it does not have depth and the disease is recent from its third day, then you pause in it on the first hour with powder, and do not tighten it so that the disease is not held in its depth, and return to the patient, and release that one two times a day; and if the disease is in the eye, then pause there also with an attractive oil.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the wound is not present, then place it in the orifice of the plunger so that the water comes out and runs through its opening; and let the patient sleep on top of the plunger so that the water runs through his body.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if after three days or more the spasms and tremors in the patient's body do not disappear, nor does his bowels move properly or his other bodily functions, then know that the plague is cured; then treat him with calamine and the other treatment until he is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if the patient's healing has been delayed and the wound is still open, then know that a fistula has formed; treat it with vinegar.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the plague is from a cut or knife wound, and it is simple on the surface of the foot or leg, then treat it with water that has been preceded by suturing, if it is large, or powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if it has already formed a pus inside the bone, and it is already separating from it, then place the wound on the plunger and squeeze out those separated parts, if they are separate.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then let it rest until the plague is expelled, which is accomplished easily.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other accidents of plague in the other members, the cure is the same as that which we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the plagues in the abdomen.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The discomfort that occurs in the abdomen can be great, small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the large hernia, there are visible bumps or swelling due to a hernia bulge and the nerve endings being very sensitive.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	A small disruption is difficult to treat in any other way, and if you do not prevent its intrusion into its place quickly, it will become very difficult, for it widens and thickens due to the intrusiveness of its contents.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the mildest disruption is better, because in this one it is not difficult to reduce the hernia, but it is difficult in the two mentioned above.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that abdominal surgery is done in four ways; but twice as many surgeries are common to all the other plagues of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two others are proper to the other plagues, but only one is proper to abdominal surgery.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to you each explanation and description.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	So I say that when the plague is small and there is no cause of the hernia for it, and it is difficult to reduce it, then it is in two ways: either because of the mildness of the disruption as we have said, or when the hernia bulge becomes thicker due to the cold air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore, when it is like this, I recommend that you cut off the hernia in such a way that you dip a sponge or cloth in tepid water alone, or that you take it into tepid water, and caraway, and aniseed, and spice, and rub on the hernia until the swelling is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	Some veal are made with a stimulant that increases their temperature, and it is better than tepid water in resolving swelling.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And if you see that the swelling has been resolved, then moisten the hernia with water in which it was placed high and cold, for by water it is eased due to a few causes.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the hernia does not respond to this treatment, then cut off a small piece of the hernia with a sharp instrument, as it is inserted there to treat hemorrhoids.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is better when it is proper that it should not be cut off, and that it should not be occupied with drying out unnecessarily and starving itself.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	As for the instrument, consider its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	The one has a sharp, the other has an obtuse, and the tip is slightly blunt, not very acute.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore, when the hernia has grown larger and is protruding from its place, then know that the reduction of it should be according to its natural shape, in its own place, if possible above water, because it is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is wide and it is in the lower part of the abdomen, then place the patient on their back, and pause their buttocks higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the abdomen, then place the head higher than the buttocks.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And apparently if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the abdomen, then pause your attention and consideration momentarily in order that the part where the plague is may be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus you will administer water in the great plagues and in the moderate plagues.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in the small plagues, prepare the water that we have said, and let the minister be between your two hands, which has the entire disruption under it and adjusts the lips of it, and let it discover the cause of the surgery from another part.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	This is the common way of suturing: one that takes the needle, or counts the needle according to the amount of the width of the plague; and let go of the end of the disruption of the little finger, and tighten the needle, or another that you do not insert into the two ends of the knot, both ends of the string that is left inside the incisions, until it enters through that incision; and you have added the two ends of the knot and made four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And let it tighten with two double threads in the circuit of the needle, and sometimes add the two ends together, and let go of the width of the finger, and let it tighten one end of it, and let that end be tied with a knot, and let it be added to the other end; and let go of the thickness of the little finger, and let another needle enter into it, and let it pass through that one, and let that one be tied with a knot, and let it be added to the other end; and do not cease to make water if need be, adding the needles until you have completed the whole tension of the plague.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the small needles be between fineness and subtlety, because the fine needles pierce the flesh easily; and the thick ones are a difficult instrument in the knot, and therefore by water let them be both fine and subtle and coarse.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And I do not know that the needle is fixed in both ends of the knot nearest to it because the flesh should not be easily pierced and the plague should not become established before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not prolong the surgery so that the plague is not prevented from being consolidated.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And let the ends of the needles poke into the patient so that they do not rest on their back and sleep; and pause over the sutures of all parts, which have the ends of the needles; and let them be inside until you know that the plague has been consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these special sutures with needles are more convenient in small plagues because they only need a single needle or two or three to hold them together.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second is like this: and it is that you administer to the four ends, of the knot and two extremities of the string, in one incision, with a needle that you have tied; and let it be wrapped up in fineness and subtlety.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And when the needle will have penetrated these four ends, reduce the needle from that meteyssa part where you began to use it, so that the thread retreats from the sub-upper part of the incision into the plague, so that the suturing is according to a stitch with thread on the cloth that has been tightened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And place between each stitch the thickness of this small thread.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this stitch knows the men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And I sewed up the wound that had been made in a man's abdomen by a knife, which had caused the eruption of a larger plague of a palm, and was an outlet for the bug of two palms from his navel and was a rupture in the middle of the member; and then I reduced what was broken so that the bug did not come out.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the plague was consolidated in the space of fifteen days or so, and I healed him and his wound was cured; and then I applied honey to it to promote healing, and he recovered his health.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other wounds had not healed; but by a miracle they healed, because I did not heal him with oil, for it was in a place where oil does not help or benefit from any medicine, but I applied a patch of wool over the wound twice a day and washed it thoroughly with honey every day until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	Then I made two kinds of stitches according to the narrative of Paracheus.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And you began to sew with the knot, and you put the needle in from the outside into the inside.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And so with the needle penetrating into the knot and into that meat, according to the prescription and length of all the body, and leaving the end of the thread in which you have put the needle; and make the needle penetrate from the outside into the inside in the middle of the body, and leave the other end of the thread at a distance from the part where you have made the first stitch.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And when you have made that penetration, then you make another stitch in the same place from the outside into the inside; and leave the end of the thread at a distance from the part where you have made the first stitch. And so you continue making stitches one after another until you have gone all around the body.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make that penetration with your needle in the thread which you have made to pass from one side of the body to the other.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	Then begin to work from that side of the body and continue your needle's work at the end which is in the middle; and bring out the thread from the other side where you have made a stitch, and tie it off there.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And make another stitch, and another, and so on until you have finished sewing everything up according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the whole method of sewing is that you sew with stitches so small that they cannot be seen; and that you sew the knot once at one end of the thread, but leave the other end free.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	And the second kind of stitch is called Gulia, and it is done by speaking and counting; that is, you sew with one knot at each end of the thread, but you add nothing between them; and you apply one end to another, and the other to the end opposite to it, and so on according to how many times you want to count.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	And when you have brought your needle to the end of the body again from where you began, and made the same kind of stitch there; then bring the needle out through one side of the body, and make another stitch on the other side from inside the body; and bring the needle back in again on the first side where you started.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	Then return those patches and make another penetration from inside the body to outside in two other places on the opposite side, which are in the middle; and bring out your needle again.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this method of sewing is better than common sewing, and it is a kind of stitch that I have mentioned before.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the speech of Gulia
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And it is called a stitch of the belly, which is made with two needles; and you should put your needle in from one side where there is a hole, and begin to make stitches according to the method described above for making stitches on animals' throats.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	You should know that when a rupture is in the middle of the belly, the stitch is more difficult than for other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	And the judgement of medicine to cure the plague is different from that of other plagues.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	And the cause is that when you bring the patient to the saint in advance of the person who has the plague, and reduce the bug and sew it up properly, then apply powdery incandescence.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then apply powdery incandescence to those parts which are in pain and which make a hard sound when touched, and they will be consolidated knot and thread; and then you will heal that person as is done for other plagues, unless it is cured.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have medicines, then apply to the wound only, and wash it thoroughly with water every day until it is healed; for you will not need other medicines in this case, since simple plagues are easily cured by applying them to the affected parts, as you have taught yourself.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the common plague will spread to the principal members, then cover those parts with wool dipped in a wet quality of oil, or rose water, and place it between the muscles and leaves them in place.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if there is pain or decay in the belly, which is caused by bad air, then apply to it a black stinging substance made of vi, and more so if the decay has reached the belly and there are pus-like emissions penetrating into its concave shape.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	You should know that the gross belly is of a kind of bad air, and it has healing power for that which is in the thin belies.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the belly that is called "gegunu" does not receive healing from any plague that enters into it of all things; and this is because there are many veins in it and they are large, and its subtlety and nearness to nature's nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if the thing that you are treating from the plague is cloth, and you bring it from a distant place, then reduce it according to your method of reducing thin bellies.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has passed into the space and has become wet or dark, then bind that place with thread tightly where it is injured, to prevent blood from flowing; for in cloth there are veins and arteries.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	Then cut off that piece, and bind two ends of the thread to the edge of the wound on both sides from where the plague has entered; so that your hand will be relieved from that attraction which it has from the cloth and emission of the plague's bad air.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Rememberance of the plagues when they occur in the belly.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a rupture occurs in the belly and is small, then it may be possible to heal some people, but that is because I have seen such a thing; for there was a man who had been struck by a lance in his stomach on the right side, and that man's plague was old and had become a fistula, and he had an abscess and putridity.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Then I saw the cure for him had not yet been found in order to heal him; but I removed the abscess from within until it healed and the place was consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I had placed a covering over the patient's abdomen, holding it down on the bed where she had been struck by misfortune; and I did not allow any misfortune or illness to strike her or her body in its natural order of things, eating and drinking, and I kept them both between baths and exercise.
