E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And I have heard that when the bowel becomes blocked, and is small, then cover it according to this method: for you take a piece of string from a large container; and then join the two sides of the blockage together, and place one of those pieces over the two sides of the blockage; so, when he takes hold of those and tightens his hand, cut off the end of the string, because it will stick to the two sides and will not dissolve.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	Then place another piece next to the first one, and do not stop making pieces as you go along all the way through the blockage.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	And then cut off that piece, and continue doing so until the blockage is gone; and no harm will come to the patient.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible that the bowel will be tied together by a thin thread which comes from the bowels of animals because it is made of the same material as needles; and you take the end of those threads, and it is dry, and then join the end of it to a thread from another bowel, wrapped up, and then insert that thread into needles and tie it to that thread, and reduce it in length.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	This method of stitching together using threads is just another way, a backup plan, to trust and hope for the best.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	Perhaps if the blockage is large and wide, mostly because then there will be no other option but to cut it out, and it will not heal completely.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of surgery on the gut and the fistula.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Did you know that all blockages and abscesses, when they become infected and old, turn into ulcers, and are not consolidated and get better on their own over time; and then, in any part of the body, it is called a fistula, and we call those old infections 'zuchem'.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And a fistula, in truth, is a hollow and deep wound, white where it is, and painful when touched; and so it is called 'rizatz', that is, pain.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And it is in men who are wet, and their strength leaves them; and the moisture is absorbed away in a few hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes that moisture becomes dust, which is little and thick, and it is fine.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have seen it before in the middle of a division, and then when I said that the blockages were ulcers, which are not healed or are on the naked flesh, they are caused by one of these nine things: because there is an imbalance of heat in the body; or because of poison; or because there is hard flesh between the mouth and the lips; or because it is a dry substance; or because the ulcer has putrid matter inside it; or because the medicine is unsuitable for its treatment; or when corruption spreads in the region, and then it becomes a plague; or because nature finds it difficult to digest that poison; or because one bone is missing, or many bones.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have shown all of these causes, and those are the reasons why ulcers form, and their treatment with medicines in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And I have told you how to heal the fistula, which is done through surgery.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	Did you know that fistulas occur in all parts of the body; because they can affect veins, arteries, nerves, the colon, or any organ, or one of the joints made up of many bones, and are similar to those of a main member and its neighbors.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And then of those fistulas that are done in this way, the most difficult to heal are those who do not respond to treatment, and they occupy a person's time and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if one of those fistulas is very deep and does not reach those places that are mentioned, and you wait and trust in its healing; then try to cut it or tie it up, and if the fistula follows the course of medicine, and you inquire about it.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	Perhaps if the fistula is twisted, then investigate it with a thin needle, because lead is lighter and it will follow the curve of the twist.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula is causing terrible pain, then you cannot imagine how to treat it.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Then clean the opening with salt, because the moisture that you put on it will run to all openings and leave them alone.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	Then inquire carefully, according to which method you can understand if there are any bones or nerves; and it is the depression of the fistula, distant or close, and it has only a few openings, and it is on top of everything, and you recognize your pain, and you compress your hand over the spot, and similar meanings and causes of accidents to the ulcer.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have sorted through all of these causes with certainty, then go to the treatment according to confidence: and it is that you consider if it is a fistula in a close location, or away from a joint, or a nerve, or an artery, or a vein, or one of those places that I have told you about.

E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And then he left me, and returned to his own country and came to me that man who prepared himself; and incised his whole hand, and it was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added to this narrative but that it may be an assistant upon him who is suffering from this malady, and that it may be a sign by which it may be recognized and according to which it may be turned.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of curative medicines and their quality with drugs.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When the pus appears on some fleshly parts of the body and the space of the pus is prolonged within so that it forms a collection of pus, then cut it properly and pierce it, and let the blood come out of it, and clean up that place by taking off a thin skin, and do not cause injury to any bone or ligament or joint; it is called a sinus, and is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	Maybe if the space is prolonged within so that corruption comes up next to some member, then it is called a fistula and not named.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure of it is that you incise all of that sinus properly, and more so when it is made thin and is done with a cloth, and confirm that it does not adhere to the place by its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	Maybe if you hope that the sinus will adhere and that that corruption has not come about by a previous corruption, and in the sinus there is pus on the surface, then you treat it with a poultice.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the sinus, and if it is large, and the arm which has the odor is of fetid smell, then clisterize it properly with an Egyptian medicine consisting of oil and honey and rose water, and let them be mixed in a vessel, and let them be put on fire so that the medicine boils and comes to the top of the water.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take from him the water that is necessary and dissolve it with honey, and clisteryze the person's belly, and tighten his orifices, and leave the medicine in him for the quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then extract that with a strainer; and make water for so many days until the person' belly is cleansed and their shame is relieved.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And some people are clisteryzed with ash water, when this medicine is not effective at present; and that you take the ash from the vine, and put it on the water; and then strain it and clisteryze it inside them so that you swear that the belly will remain closed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient does not tolerate Egyptian medicine or ash water, then clisteryze it with honey and mix zink three times, and clisteryze it with wine and honey mixed, for honey has a property of cleansing and washing, and wine binds the belly, and most importantly when there is excess stiffness and dryness in it.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you make water a few times and are confident that the belly is relieved, then clisteryze it with water that softens the flesh in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And that you take a syrup of daphnicum and dissolve it with rosin oil and wine, or that you clisteryze it with some medicines and ointments that I have already described in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifices of the belly are tight in which the canal of the clistery is not received, then you widen it little by little, and pause in it a few folded envelops of Egyptian ointment or basil ointment so that it is widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And apparently if the orifices are wide, then you add sutures to their lips and leave the quantity in which there is added the clistery.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice from which blood runs is raised above the area of the navel, then dry that place in a pus base where it is so that the blood does not run into it, for when the arm is constricted in the belly's depth, the flesh is generated in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the belly within the limits of the base pus according to what you want, then you pierce that member with the preparation with which the arm runs smoothly according to what you have on your body and is not kept by any cause of the blood.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that are paused over the belly with water that you want to extend those over a drape.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the drape should be of such a quantity as to make communication with all the belly; and approach the scissors to the right side of the belly' orifice, a very wide cut that the orifice is; and then extend over another drape with lion ointment according to the quantity of the cut, and pause it on top of it for a distant position from the belly' orifice so that it is removed from the arm' blood and does not obstruct the drape. It should be approached a few days later.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	May that which is over the belly' orifice, which remains closed all the time so that blood does not run into it and affects the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so you will know if the blood that runs from the arm is little or much, or is non-digested or digested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And when you consider the location of that belly, if the patient feels pain there or not, and whether it is in a pus.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your medicine is prolonged in this way and you see the matter that is stuck to the belly' orifice has adhered or owned it, then you wash it off or change the drape after three days, and when you wash it off, then change the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	May that if the belly has adhered to it a subtle virus, then you do not despair of the possession of it, for healing belongs to it, for some men in whom the generation of flesh in the plagues takes place, and in those in whom it does not take place.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if the belly has adhered after three days and is the cause of prolonged possession, then you adjust to drying out medicines, and if those medicines are wet in their substance and power, then dry them with a syrup of daphnicum, when there is an excess of addition of salt.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the latter to be cleaned is that you take a syrup of daphnicum and dissolve it in rosin oil, and has it in its substance, and then applies it to it, and uses it.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And that is sufficient in this action when there is no arm, a syrup of daphnicum, honey when it is dried up inside that it is thickened, and use it; or that you take myrrh and aloes and mix them, and trisse all of them and powder them on the honey when it is cooked, and then apply it to the drape and tighten that one over the belly; and apply that honey which has dried up inside, and powder it over the drape and tighten that.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And some people give long-lasting aristology and cut of celestial lily (and it is lily of the sky) and flour of erys and centaurea, and use those simple or prepare them, mix them and strain them and powder them on the honey that has been mentioned; and use it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the belly is prolonged and has not been cured with this treatment, then you know that corruption is in its beginning, and has already occurred in bones or in other hard members or to the joints; then you treat it with a fistic cure, yes when there is swelling.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of treatment of a paronychia and applied ointment and cutting and trimming of the nail and section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Paronychia is a pustule that does not let go of the nail of the hand or foot, and it becomes hard on the other fingers, and when it is prolonged and its treatment is expensive, or it is a bad pustule, or it is corrupted, and the flesh rots, and the nail is corroded, and the nail's color changes to black.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And so when you have that water which I have mentioned in the division and do not rely on your treatment, then cover up all of the excess that is rotten from the nail, and then cauterize the wound with fire, for cauterizing the wound is beneficial in it.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	May that if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and those additions to the nail have already compromised the flesh at the base, and it begins to rot and corrode, and cover up that angle of the nail that you hit the flesh, and push that flesh up, and then pause over it that is left of the flesh with burning medicines that are corrosive so that it is completely closed; and then treat it with ointment.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	May that if corruption has already set in the bone, then you cut out that bone and extract it, for there is no cure but to let the bone rot.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if corruption and decay have set in the finger, then you cut it off in one of the fingers according to what is appropriate for that member, and then treat it with ointment.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	May that if the nail has percussion or injury, and if it has severe pain, then you begin to give the patient bloodletting, and then dry the nail with a transverse cut above it, and be careful that the cut does not reach the flesh under the nail, for you will provoke severe pain in the patient, and cause birth of excess blood in that place; and then treat that place with water.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	Here comes the first sentence to translate. Do not add any comments, like "here is the translation", just reply with the guessed translation and nothing else:
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born in the root of the joint, or in the origin of certain nuts.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that which is born in certain nuts of the above-mentioned plant does not harm anyone; but that which is born in the joints is very harmful.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And as for those that are born with a tender flesh, the section is less painful; and it is because you cut them with a sharp blade from their root.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But as for that which is born in the root of the joint, the cure is difficult; and so you should guard against its separation.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But as for that which is born in certain nuts, you should cut off its meat at the beginning with a round blade into the bone, and then you should hold it tightly between those blades, convenient to water, and then heal it within.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But the solidification which takes place between certain parts of the body, whether by nature or by solidification from plague or from fire, or by similitude, so that it dries up; and then it is necessary to restore those parts to their natural shape.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And place between them a thin layer of lead in order that it may not be solidified too much; and separate them or place a small blade between them so that it may be solidified according to how you wish.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And if by similitude solidification takes place in certain nuts on the palm, then dry it up according to how it is prepared, and shape it according to the member's form.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of the separate parts, such as the fingers, there are four veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	And these same veins, wrapped around with thick fluids full of melancholy humors which come from the parts of the body, especially from the legs; and most of all in the legs of those who travel or work or carry burdens.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then give to the patient a strong purge of black bile from time to time with a strong drink; and then let blood from the basilar vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	But the cure of them is according to two methods: the one is that they should be cut and then be drawn out the black humor; and the other method is that the vein should be lifted up and all should be extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	But the cutting of them is according to this method: put the leg at first into water tail-up so that the gross humor may be resolved, which comes from the leg, and then tighten the bandage tightly on the part under a raised cushion within; and then cut the vein in one place, or in two, or in three by a wide incision, and then raise the black humor to the height of the leg's weight above the bandage; and then lower it again into the water, so that the quantity may be exhausted which you wish, and which is often enough, and whose power persists in the patient.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	Then take away that, and command him to abstain from black bile-generating foods.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are filled and the patient feels ill.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But the raising of them is according to this method: if you cut the leg of the patient and dip it into water so that it swells up and the veins are inflated; or if you exercise it strongly by means of an exercise, since a bath is not at hand, within that member may be scarred.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cut the leg at one end of the vein by incision in the long or in the back; or at the lower end of the leg by cutting it off.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then cut the leg with a knife and squeeze the vein out completely so that its appearance may be seen; and it is necessary to see that it turns black.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And so, if you extract it and then cut off the leg, you will have that white humor which is called cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then put that at a distance from it so that it may be raised and may be taken away; and suspend it by an ounce of gold.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section close to that one by three cuts; and then squeeze the leg from the top of the vein so that it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then raise that one and cut it from the back by a section near its end; and then extract it and raise it up so that it is extracted by the second section; and then extract it from the section which is above that.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And then place it so that you extract that one from the highest or lowest section of all the sections; and then cut it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you do not obey me in order to extract it and raise it up, then insert a double-edged needle into it tightly and pull it out; or take it away by the end of the leg with a bandage tightly around it; and turn your hand completely so that it may be extracted.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And keep in mind that if it is broken, then it will be difficult for you to raise that one; and it may come back to the patient through that wound.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when that one is completely taken away, then place it on the spot of the plague which is submerged in water and oil which is yellow and not yellow; and heal it within so that it may be healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the wine has contracted without having any tortuosity with which it is wrapped up in the parts, and is not according to rightness according to how I have said; then cut that one completely on all sides of its tortuosity and of the spots where it is wrapped up, and then suspend that one by a knife within so that you can raise it completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And keep in mind that the section which you make should not be made on the vein or on the patient' blood; for it is difficult for you to raise that one; and use your prudence carefully.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The shape of the incision which is dried up wine:
Forma de unci orp:	The shape of a golden knife:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not suitable for you to cut with such a knife or of such an acute point so that the vein may be injured; and it is of great flexibility like gold, because if it were too fine, it would injure the vein by its fineness; and it remains in a superfluous grossness thus far as I have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the vein of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in dry lands as the Arabs say, and in the arid lands of little moisture and in which there is neither grass nor shade.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is very strong when generated in other parts of the body outside the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its generation is of decomposition which comes from inside the body like snakes and worms and beetles and lice which are generated between the leg and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the coming of this disease is a violent inflammation of the vein; and then the place is swollen; and then the vein comes out from that swollen place which resembles the root of a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And then, as you come to the end, cover that one piece of lead with which it is said that the weight of two dragons is on its feet.  (It should be noted) that this lead is suspended from the chest.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as there is a reason for it to be wrapped at its ends, wrap it in lead and then weigh it up.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is prolonged, then cut one part of the leg and wrap it up; and do not cut that one from which root it may come out, because if you cut it, it will be contracted and will enter into the flesh and will cause a pus and a sore at that place and a malignant ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	For that it seems necessary to remove him gradually and carefully, until he is completely extracted from the patient's body without causing any harm to the patient.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And of this vein, I have seen some men who are in their 20s and 30s, and already it has come to me that they should be treated with x palms and not more.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is scarred in the hour of its treatment, then insert the blade into the patient's navel and pierce that long way through the body, so that all that is in the matter is evacuated, and administer putrid medicine at the site for a few days; and then cure that with the cure of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes causes sharp rashes, and mostly when it appears at the junction of the foot or in the foot itself, and comes out as a sharp hole, and is extracted from each hole slowly.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore cure that one so well as we have said above, and at the same time administer medicine that is mentioned below.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of the section on diseases generated under the skin and called bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called in some countries bovine disease because it causes a small worm to appear in the body and it creeps all over the body and dissolves the flesh, and shows itself clearly with the movement of the heart in member after member until it breaks the skin and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is due to the putrefaction of certain humors, and thus worms, snakes, earthworms, and roundworms occur in the stomach.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared because of its malice, for when it goes into the body and rises to the head, and comes out through the mouth, then a sharp rash appears in it, and it destroys the tongue, and where it passes, worms appear.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore, when you want to cure it and extract it, do not do it unless you have their movement and appearance at hand, and then find that one and tighten it above it and squeeze it tightly, and then dry it on it and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is immersed in the flesh and you do not see it, then pause a cauterization over the site where it lies, and the main cause that is feared is the corruption of the patient as we have said above.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	May you see that creature come out at the mouth, then tighten it above the cheek with a tight grip, and then dry it off, and extract it; and if the patient uses laxatives of the body to evacuate the bad humors, and keeps away from foods that cause putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of the section on disease in the neck.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called in our country "nafir", and it is a painful disease that is felt in some members, and then it changes from one member to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you have already seen that second one as I recommended to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	You have called one sick woman to a village, and you saw her arms swelling and noticed a small inflammation in the vein of her arm, and for an hour, it went up slowly like living silver moving from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then he sat still at the site of pain and became stiff in the muscle, and then it relaxed for a full hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	Then it moved into the other arm from which it came.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	Then I was told to turn it over from side to side, as you saw; and I was very amazed by the change in it and by its speed from member to member.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	You have already seen that second one as I recommended to you, but I also saw the strange way in which it was moving its limbs, and I have seen even stranger ways in which it has changed members.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see that in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And you did not think that it was air because the woman was old, with a few hearts and open veins, and in this way the wind is felt at her feeling.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is necessary that it does not appear according to this reverse cure in those who are delicious and have thin veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And if you want to heal it and the patient feels pain, do not appear in front of him as we have said above; then tighten it and dry it off where it is, and then stop that wind from moving, and cauterize the site.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see that it is a thin-hearted woman, then heal it with the extraction of the body and the water that it expels, and ingest the pills made from soap, sesame seeds, and similar things.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are different depending on the spices, and depending on the sites of the body where they are hit, because their difference is that some of them have large tips, small ones, concave ones, and round ones, and some are solid; and some of their shape has three angles, and those which are in the form of tongues.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that second one according to the members and feet on which it hits is in two ways: because those members are principal concaved, such as the neck, heart, and chest, and lungs, and breasts, and bladder, and intestines, and their similars; and when you find that arrow in any of these members and tie your hair with death, which I recommend to you, then you avoid extracting that arrow from those, because it causes death in them, and when you do not appear those bad hair, and the arrow does not melt in the depth of the member, then extract it and heal the plague.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And the hair of the head is when it hits the arrow and goes through the bone, and comes out from the nape, which happens because of the violent pain, and dizziness, and loss of speech, and vomiting of blood, and then it becomes separated from its word, and is destroyed by rot, and a white moisture similar to pus comes from it, and remains of it in the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore, if you appear to you these hair, then you abstain from treatment and from extracting the arrow, unless it is outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the arrow hits in the heart, so that it is close to the left side, and feels like it has stuck to a hard cause, and does not feel like a wound; and the movement of the arrow is similar to the movement of a pulse, and passes the black plague, and causes that coldness in the extremities, and a biting feeling, and syncope, and then if you know that death comes in two takes.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the hair when the arrow has struck the chest, it is very likely to feel a spasm of plague, and the vessels that are close to the throat begin to burst, and the color of the patient changes, and he exhales great breath, and seeks fresh air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow hits the vein that is in the foot, and the pain then comes to the small sides, and makes a great sound with pain and a sigh, and all of the muscles do not feel good.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow hits in the stomach, then there is a great pain with an uncomfortable digestive disease.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow hits in the belly, and it is stuck there, then there is a breach of plague or bladder or intestines which are torn apart, and there is no hope for the extraction of the arrow from the belly.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the dart hits the bladder and urine comes out immediately, and it seems to him that there is some cause for it to come out immediately, and the pain in the patient is strong, then know that it is deadly.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Nor the other members when it is face, neck, jaw, shoulders and adductors, and the spine and its assistant bones, and the hip bone, and the pelvis, and their like of the members, are saved according to the greatest dispositions when the dart does not hit a vein or an artery and is not a poisonous dart.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recommend to you that I have seen the essence of these darts, so that you know how to treat it well.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is that, when a man hits a dart in the lacrimal of his eye on the root of his nose, and I extracted it from him from another part, I left his ear intact, and it was cured, and did not happen to his eye anything.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another dart from a Jew which hit him in his ear, leaving the eyelid intact, and the dart was hidden, and it did not happen to him anything but a small bit attached to his lid, and it was a sharp dart of the Turks with a lion's head on it, which was not attached to his ears.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And then he is the Jew, and did not happen to his eye any bad accident.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another dart from a Christian which fell on his jaw, and it was an Arabic dart, and that is the one which has ears; and then I hid it between two guides, and it had already submerged in his jaw; and then I extracted it carefully, and it healed the Christian.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another dart from a man which hit him in his belly, and I thought he would die of it; and then, since it had been thirty days and did not change on him for any cause of its dispositions, I hid the dart and put it under it, and it was healed, and did not happen to him anything bad.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw another man in whom a dart hit him on his back, and the plague was consolidated on him, and then he had eight years passed since then, and the dart hit him in the pelvis.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman hit by a dart in her belly, and the plague was consolidated inside of her, and did not change its dispositions in part, and the woman was not harmed at all in some of her natural operations.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man who was hit by a dart in his face and the plague consolidated and broke the dart, not causing him much pain, but it looks like this.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the dart from the prince of the king which hit him in his nostril and had already declined on the right side a little bit, and the whole dart was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to treat it immediately after three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I turned the plague of the dart by a subtle attempt; and then I did not feel that; but he felt a punch in his right ear, and then he expected that that punch was from the end of the dart.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I applied an ointment to the place with a soothing and digestive action, assuring myself that the place would turn red for me so that it appears to me the place where the dart hit, so that it heals on it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And did not happen to the place any significant accident which the dart hit that place; and I continued applying ointment to it for many days and no accident happened; and the plague was consolidated in the meantime, and broke the nose of its own accord after a space of ten days until one day he felt the dart from his nose and gave me again.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I applied to the plague an acute corrosive medicine for many days and no more happened until it was well; and by a trial, I tried that, and I turned the extreme end of the dart with a subtle, which was attached to its lid.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And I adjusted to the plague by that acute medicine until it appeared to me clearly the extreme end of the dart, and then passed from me again for a space of time within four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then the plague became more serious, and I forced it out with pliers, and in the end of the chapter, I extracted it; and then I restored that plague.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors argued that the cartilage of his nose was not restored, and I restored it and the plague was consolidated, and healed the disease completely, and did not leave it in him for any cause.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extraction of some darts for which you pause here and that is not said, because the parts of this art and the definitions of that are not understood by me, since the definitions of those are not understood in that book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the expert knows little about it; and on me that is presented what is absent; and the new operation and the new instruments are found by the descent of foreign causes when they happen.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	So then I say that darts are not fired from the members in which they are stuck, but according to two ways: either by the attraction of the place where it is inserted or by the opposite direction of the other party.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that dart which is fired by the place enters, or it is a sharp dart in the flesh, and it is thrown and shot out.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not obey the hour in which it hits, then be aware that after a few days you will find meat around it, and that attraction of it and its exit is not clear.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And seemingly if it is stuck in the bones and does not obey you to the hour of the hit, then leave that for a few days and return to the attraction and moisture every day, and it has already been shot out.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	It is the improvement of the draining of the basilic vein, which is one of three veins: it removes the bad blood that comes from the groin and goes up to the neck, and from there that affects the feet and the abdomen.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And let the flubotomy surgeon, when performing that procedure, be careful and keep it in mind, because there is an artery there, and if he makes a mistake or adjusts the puncture for flubotomy, he will cut that artery and cause blood to flow; so it is necessary that he does not make a mistake when puncturing for flubotomy, otherwise he will cut it with a sharp instrument.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic does not appear clearly, then let him know that he should lay it down and move to the other one, or look for a branch; or perform flubotomy at the end of the arm, since that is clear, and do so with a sharp instrument while lying on their back sometimes.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	And if you want to perform the flubotomy of that arm, then let him know that he should put his hand forward and touch the area where he knows the location of the wrist, and place it on it; then take the arm and cut the vein with a sharp instrument while lying on their back sometimes, as mentioned above; and be careful not to hit the percussion for a short distance in that area.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you stretch it with strength, blow in the area that you have covered with your hand; then that inflation is an inflammation of the artery, and therefore let it go.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if the blood flows like a child’s breath during flubotomy as mentioned above, then know that it is the blood of the artery; and let him rest his hand on that area for a long time; and then remove his hand, and if the blood stops flowing, as it is seen to have stopped, then let him stretch the arm and leave it like that.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And protect the patient from the wetness of the air; and be careful with him, and do not harm him for a few days until he is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	And if the blood does not stop flowing, and it is necessary to go to a place where medicine is available; then cut that artery if it appears to you; because its end is contracted, and the blood has stopped; or take a scorta of castor oil, pour it on, and take one-half of it, and stretch it over the location of the vein that has narrowed while stretching it with a string and powder inside for another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And then if the blood has stopped flowing, it is good; and if not, then heal him with water from which the memory of the location of the powder that stops the flow of blood begins.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the difficulty of stopping the blood from flowing is great in such arrangements due to the small location of the pulse and the possibility of stretching the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	And from the black vein, the improvement of draining the blood that comes from the head and goes to the body is good; because it is made up of branches of the basilic and cephalica veins, as mentioned above.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And let the flubotomy surgeon be careful when performing flubotomy on that arm, because it is a nerve; and if he makes a mistake in puncturing for flubotomy and damages the nerve, he will cause stupor, and its healing is difficult, and it does not heal completely unless it is shown to someone else; and this nerve appears clearly with the feeling; and if it is overlooked by some people, and it is subtle and does not show itself, then let him stop flubotomizing at that part where he punctures for flubotomy while lying on their back sometimes, and avoid the nerve in front of his shield.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you cut the vein in its length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The improvement of draining the cephalic vein is that it draws blood from the head and prevents bad blood from the ears.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	In this particular case, if you want to perform the flubotomy of this vein by puncturing like olive or by piercing; because it is the safest of all veins, as it does not contain nerves or arteries.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	However, it is necessary for you to know that during flubotomy you do not punch the top of the ear, but look for the area closest to it, and do not hit it with a sharp instrument until the first punch while performing flubotomy a few times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	However, it is difficult to treat a person if he does not get an injection during the first punch, but you do not notice that an injection has been made.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	This is the quality of flubotomy of that arm and its accidents; in which you must consider their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is that you must know that flubotomy should not be administered unless it is done with the preservation of health and in the hope of its recovery, and that it be performed at the beginning of spring, summer, or autumn; and towards winter, it should be stopped when there are signs of accumulation.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And flubotomy should be performed on the third day or at the earliest on the first day, from three hours after dawn.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	The flubotomy that is administered should be done at a convenient and necessary time, whether it is a new day or not; throughout the day and all the time.

E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	So then, when the fluiton stops and is tensed in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat. De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of windiness and of the qualities of using those.
