Then put a cloth on the member, so that the cloth provides nourishment to it, or continue with a shower of water, so that the nutriment runs and returns to its natural figure.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Of the treatment of broken bones when they are restored with torture, and prohibit the operation of them unless necessary.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When the member is already restored as a result of healing a broken bone and an injury that causes pain in the form of the member, but this member is not prevented from its natural operation, so you should accept the word that this member has been recently broken.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But many bad symptoms and healing methods have already occurred in our land, and this operation is very painful, causing great fear of the sign that brings death.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	But if the claudication and injury are recent, then consider that they be wrapped in a warm water bath in which herbs with soothing properties are added, as well as leaves of mint and raisin, and honey, applied to it; or that it is coated with a paste made from a herbal infusion, or that it is rubbed with a liniment of gualine or olive oil extracted from chamomile, and wrapped in a cloth; or that it is dressed with dried fig leaves, and similar to those of the medicines that are called dry consolidation.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And sometimes it is dissolved with frequent light friction that is kept moist, and applied at all times.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	But if the torture has already been done in advance, and it is severe and has become a pain that provokes the need for treatment with iron, then consider that the pus above be removed and the continuous bone be dissolved, and insert into it those excesses of injury from that member by means of a very delicate scalpel, and administer ease to it wherever it is needed, and study carefully.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of speech in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is when any of the joints of the member is displaced from its place, so that it is prevented from moving, and the figure of the member is changed, causing great pain and severe damage.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Then when a dislocation occurs, pierce it so that it is reduced quickly, because if it is delayed, the joint becomes fixed and very difficult to reduce.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And so, it is not necessary to stretch or tighten it at the time of reduction, because this causes spasms and pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	Then when it happens to you, consider that you undergo an operation called flaubotomia on the member, and leave it to rest while it is reduced; then wrap the member in warm water and oil, and reduce it easily.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And the whole member be healed with that water, so that the memory of it will return to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have ordered that the joints be moved according to what is described in the fracture; from the top of the body it comes into the bottom part.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter .xxiiii.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	About the treatment for dislocated jaw: leave it alone.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	If the two jaws are not set back soon after being dislocated, or if they are slightly moved by a little handling and become softened a little; or if they are completely dislocated and fully moved apart, so that they do not close again, nor is there saliva in the mouth, and the tongue is wrapped up with the words.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation is small, then in the major part of the cases return by themselves for a small cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is whole and complete, then cover that it may be administered with a little reduction, and not be delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the minister has the head of the patient, and inserts his hand into his throat at the root of the dislocation of the jaw inside the mouth, if the dislocation is from one side; or that he inserts both hands together, if the dislocation is from two sides, and the other parts of him are apart; and orders the patient to cease moving his jaws and to place them back in their places; and the doctor makes the jaw fit and closes it.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	But if the reduction is difficult, and more so if both jaws are completely dislocated, then administer a vapour of water and oil, so that the reduction of both be made a little and not be delayed at all in making the reduction of both, as I have said above.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And so, when they return and are closed up together, and the mouth of the patient is not softened, then put a cloth on those parts, and make it with wax and oil rolled up; and then let it be held in place with ease by means of soft ligatures.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient lie on his back, and the head between two pillows, so that he does not spit out at right or left; and do not force him to swallow anything; have his own food, but when the pains return and the jaws are closed, then give him what he wants to drink.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this water should be administered with ease, and not work on the mouth's opening while eating, drinking, and swallowing, so that the jaw is closed and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of both jaws is difficult when they are completely dislocated at any time, and do not return to their places, then very often fever and soda will happen, and a strong belching from the patient's belly, and a strong vomiting of pure cholera will occur.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see water, then know that it is a waste; and very often the patient dies within ten days from the time he drank water.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter.xxv.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	About the reduction of the dislocation of the furchetta and the end of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The furchetta is not dislocated from the body at its base because of the continuity with the foot; and some are dislocated from the outside part, and water is used to this end.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration is that the patient jumps on his back and spreads his legs.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then put the place on the palm of your hand with a strong grip, because it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And then place over that plaster and dust, and tighten it up.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the end of that muscle which seizes you is not dislocated in any day; then it is reduced and closed up as I have said, and according to your costume.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then place over that plaster, and dust, and tighten up, and order the patient to stay quiet and at rest until it is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And in this cure for the shoulder joint, the end of the muscle is separated from its place when reduced.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter.xxvi.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	About the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways; and one of them is dislocated at the top of the rib, at the top part.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated at the bottom part of the rib muscle, and this should not be done; nor is it dislocated from behind by the shoulder, nor from in front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And most often it is dislocated and comes out at the bottom part of the rib, and most often in those parts where the meat is small, it is slightly dislocated; but in those where there is a lot of meat, it comes out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And very often, in some people, there is a pounding or a shock; and the muscle of the patient is bruised with a bruise, and it is known that it has been dislocated by water that has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Then you should wait until you are no longer wet from it, and then proceed with the treatment of the patient.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	It is known that the dislocation of the patient is when he is at the bottom part of the rib; but so that you can distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the other, because there is a great difference between them; and it is known that the top of the rib is concav to the side, and the top of the rib is touched with the head in such a way that one can put his hand on it, and the patient cannot reduce it back into its place at his ear, nor can he move it at all.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated from the foot or from the leg, then you should feel a clear touch; and do not cover it up.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And of this dislocation there is a little reduction when it is fresh and the patient does not eat.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of the patient is that the minister raises his hand up to the top part of it; then he puts the strings on each side of the rib of the patient, and tightens them with strength towards their place, and the minister raises the patient's hand up, and spreads it out; and then he puts those strings aside because they return slightly.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if by water that I have said does not return, and only from the beginning of the dislocation; then the patient is bathed in cold water and given a massage to soften it and relax it, as if his joints were being moved by a warm oil; and fenugrec, and meletum in water, is administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And the patient should be raised on his back and be placed with his legs apart in such a way that the ends of the rib are suspended by themselves; and the doctor places his hand on the top part of the rib, and raises it towards its place, and the other minister holds the head so that it is not moved to the outside, because that returns quickly.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you want to, reduce it in this way: and it is known that you should have been present with a man who was longer than the patient, and stand on the same side of him; and insert his hand into the bottom part of the rib of the patient, and raise it up towards its place while the patient remains suspended in the air, and the other minister holds the patient' head so that it does not move to the outside, because that returns quickly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is weak, then know that he may be suspended by himself because of another cause; for the dislocation returns quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And if it is necessary to make incisions on the surface of the body, then do so with a sharp knife, not too thick or thin, and place them on the patient's thigh; because they are placed on top of the thigh, the leg should be positioned according to the length of the thigh, and the hand should be extended to the cuts on one side of the leg while the other side is held firm, for the joint returns to its position quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce the patient for any of the reasons mentioned above, then use this cure: and that you take a long pole whose length is two brazen staff, and whose width is four fingers, and whose thickness is lessened at the end that fits into the hole according to this shape:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And place the round end of the pole on top of the thigh, with lions' claws so that the pole does not slide off the thigh.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And place it on the patient's thigh below the knuckle, and extend the arm or hand above the pole where it is joined to the other part, and tie the pole firmly onto the assistant and arm and the end of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then place the arm on a step according to its width, and extend the hand at one end, and suspend the other side because the joint enters so quickly.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the patient's joint is completely relaxed according to each of the ways that are possible for you, and then cover it with a large quantity of wool; then place a plaster made from flour and egg white on top of the muscle, so that it is turned over itself, and then tighten it at the knuckle with a strap; and let the joint be turned over the plaster, and the hand be connected to its neck, and let it not be moved for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And when the patient' hand is rested enough so that the member is comfortable, because it becomes easier to heal it.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	Then give them more food after seven days or less, and exercise the movement; and if it does not soften and become easier, then it is healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	If the joint is dislocated due to moisture that occurs on it or for any other reason, then according to what has been said in the chapter on cauterization, three caustic substances should be used:
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if it still does not heal and has been seven days since the dislocation, then a few spots of caustic substance should be applied to it, and if that does not work, and the joint does not become stiff and firm again, then you will know that the nerves in it, which are at the end of the muscle, have split or stretched out or softened, and you will know that the joint will never heal in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	From the dislocation of that hand or leg, the reduction should be done with a sudden and swift movement towards the body, while returning to its position should be slow and gentle.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And the other constraint should be applied to it, and that cure should be used until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if there is a heavy burden on the member and delay in its movement, then the patient should use bathwater that has been heated to ease the burden and restore the member's natural function first.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the Treatment of a Dislocated Shoulder
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You should know that the shoulder joint is dislocated with great difficulty and seems to return with great difficulty; and it is dislocated at both ends, mainly at the front and back, and when the dislocated shoulder is adjusted with the hand's movement, it is clearly stated that the joint is convex and cannot bend the arm or touch it to its muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And if you have these symptoms, then reduce the dislocation as soon as possible because, if it goes to the shoulder joint, difficult is its reduction, and fort it does not heal completely; and more so when it is at the back because there are many types of shoulder dislocations, and they cause great pain, and some of them give death quickly.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when that is possible to reduce, is that the hand be extended with two arms, and the muscles be spread out, and the other side be placed on top of the shoulder, and let it press the joint with the back of the hand, or with the palm, so that it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	If the dislocation is at the front end, then return it so that it bends at the wrist with the palm facing itself.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer violent heat quickly and strongly.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And that two ministers extend their arms, and have this extension of two ministers so that it is not shaken by the heat.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Then turn the arms around completely, because it is wrapped in a long cloth over the hand, or limb.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the hand touches the joint with its palm, oil it with some oil to help it move easily; and immediately press the joint with a violent push so that it returns to its place.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	Then the reduction of it should be done on top of a paste that is stiffened with egg white, and stretched with salt, and let it be suspended from its neck, and left alone for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	Then it should be relaxed; and if the joint returns to its place, then you release the member from its body, and leave it alone.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not strong, then you repeat the paste and member release, and leave it alone for several days before stretching again; and then release it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	If there is a heavy burden on the reduction of the joint and its movement, then administer bathwater with friction and compression, but make it lighter; or pause over the joint and let it rest, and leave it alone for the day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	Then wrap the member in a bath; and when it is hot, then you rub the joint with gentle friction, and immediately repeat the rubbing on top of the joint so that it rubs, and the third time,
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already begun to spread on the denuded flesh inside the bath, but it is limited.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, pause over that cow's hide that is wet and scraped with the edge, and rub it gently; because that hide is wet and you restore its movement.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the Treatment of a Dislocated Shoulder (continued).
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	A few veins of the hand are dislocated, and the reduction of it is light, but the opposite is true for other joints; however, it is important to know that the speed of reducing a dislocated joint in an hour when it is separated from its place is faster than when it occurs within the caustic substance.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of the dislocated joint is that you place the knuckle of the hand on a table and have a minister extend the hand, and have the other side placed on top of its joint, or hold it near the joint, and press it with the palm so that it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, it is important to consider if the palm is already showing when the hand is closed; then place the two hands on a table before extending and reducing; and if the dislocation occurs previously, then have the two hands placed on top of each other, and let the knuckles meet with the palms; and if the dislocation occurred later, then place the two hands on the table, so that the knuckles of one hand are against the palm of the other.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And therefore, if you return soon, it is good; but if not, then wait for him to be well-healed and healed; and do not do this again, because unless he suffers or can no longer tolerate the reduction of his hernia, more days will pass without improvement.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But the Roman joint is second to its tortuosity; and there is no cause for the patient, except that his hand is swollen and cannot be tightened for any reason; therefore you know that the nerves are twisted or torn, and do not press them in one place because they will tighten again, and give them some strength.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore, if you have returned to health, then pause on the patch that we have removed and let it heal and get stronger over a few days; and then remove it again and exercise his hand.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if his movement remains stiff and occurs in the hand some pain or discomfort; then gently rub it with water and some oil, until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the treatment of dislocations.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some injuries may be dislocated at first.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a digit is dislocated at the first joint of the hand or foot, then tighten it and push the dislocation back into place, unless it returns on its own.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the tip of the finger, and suspend that part in which it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	Then hang it up and stretch it out until the third day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when night comes, let him lie in that position according to the previous description, and do not stop removing it on the third day and exercising his hand, and let him sleep at night; and make him strict for a few days until he is well.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And make him similar to himself, if it is dislocated at the base of the hand, and let him lie on that side, and perform the first operation on his digit, unless he is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And make him similar to himself when it is dislocated at other joints.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of dislocations of the spine on the arm.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When a complete dislocation of the spine on the arm or neck occurs, and the bones come out of their places, then there is no cure for this, because death comes to the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And this is the reason that the vomit of the patient is outside his will, and he cannot hold it back; and some limbs of him or two legs or two arms of him become soft, because bones are broken in four places; and the dislocation of them to four parts is accomplished.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore that person has been dislocated at the back joints and is called gelbosity.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But the treatment of him is that you should consider if the gelbosity occurs from youth, because there is no cure or remedy for it in general.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in that person who has been dislocated by a sudden blow or by a fall or by chance to those, the ancient doctors have said many methods of treatment with long speech, of which the least returns and is renewed by me from another instrument, with which I have treated him and made him well.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	I say that in gelbosity that occurs from dislocation at the front of the foot, there is no cure or remedy for it; and by analogy with that which occurs at the back.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those, there is no cure except that which occurs in the hand, which I have removed.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And that the patient lie on his face with his head turned to one side, and be extended on the other side of him an instrument wet with water so that it does not rub against his feet.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	Then place a firm stick under his head, fixed in the ground at the end of the foot where it turns, and another under his feet at the other end of the foot;
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister hold one stick, and does not put it in a hole; and the other minister holds the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then wrap his head in a cloth and tie it securely; then extend the end of the limb that is at the top of the stick, which supports his head, and let him lie on it; and then adjust all the limbs and let them lie on the other stick, which should support his feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	Then the minister drops one limb at the end of the stick, and does not lock the two sticks and limbs in their places; but they should be left loose in this way, as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor should place his palms on the spine with strength until it returns to its place, or on a table, and should adjust his feet on the table until it returns to its place.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return in this way, then find a table whose length or width is at an angle of three bras to one side from where the patient lies; and dig into the wall on that side at which end of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	Then the minister should place the table's leg on the spine, and the doctor his feet on the other end; then he should adjust himself so that the spine is held in its place, and let him return to his place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open the trap which is rolled up at the feet; and it should be that you lie on your back with your head at the end of two sticks, whose length is a palm, and your feet at the other end; and make the length between each stick a palm, and already it has been made in such a way that when one runs down it turns, and the other is held firm on the ground so that it does not roll.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let there be a round stick in which is the trap, and it is rolled up in the two traps of the two sticks;
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of him is a trap in which the stick is rolled up, whose length is a palm with which it is rolled up; and in the other two sticks is the same as this one.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then adjust the limbs that you have tightened in the feet of the patient on the trap in which the head should lie, and adjust the limbs that you have tightened on the legs of the patient on the table in which the feet should lie; and make those same adjustments as these ones.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	Then it is right that each trap should be opened and a minister twist the trap with his hand, and the doctor tighten the spine as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	This is the form of the trap:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	Then when the spine has returned to its place and is wrapped up, then put on a dry cloth on the table with a hole in which you can put your foot; then cover it over with an oil cloth and make it firm. And if it is necessary to return the limb to its place, then do so; and let him lie on that side where the gelbosity occurred.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	Then make him use the limb that we have said, and give him subtle food to eat until he is well.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there is some urgency in the place at the end of the cure, then make him take medicines that moilify and soften by long time, which we have recommended; and already it has been administered in that place a plate of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And in some cases there is imminent danger at the rear of the two vertebrae, and that is caused by dislocation; and that is the bone which I have already touched so that it does not come to be done prosompcion to him with this medicine because it will fort make you to happen death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter .xxxi.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Do you know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle do not occur except by dislocation so much, and do not happen to those water that happen to other joints with little movement and concave.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated in four ways, because it is dislocated inwardly, or outwardly, or forward, or backward.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And most often it is dislocated inwardly, and less so forward or backward.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of a hip dislocation inwardly is that when you adjust the curve of the hip to the hip, it is longer and the back is more curved than before, and the hip cannot bend the leg without pain, and this is the place that stops the pain from stopping suddenly so that the top of the thigh has already come here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of one who has a dislocation outwardly is that the accidents of him are opposite to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of one who has a dislocation backward is that he expands his own curve according to suit, but above all he does not bend that part which hurts him behind, and if he tries to walk on it, his urine is repressed and his limb becomes swollen, and he must walk with a stick.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of one who has a dislocation backward is that he does not expand the back, nor can he bend that part in front which bends the hip, and his curve is shorter than the other, and the swelling of his limb is softened, and the top of the thigh has already come to this place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, so it is already advanced with age; therefore, administer to him a reduction of it according to his disposition, then it does not come to be done prosompcion.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in that one of the dislocation is recent and is one of the four species of dislocation, then you should cut off to water that turns the joint and extends it to the inside and outside, and makes it turn to the right and left, because it easily returns and does not require another cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But, if it does not return in this way, then you must prepare a strong medicine and extend the curve of him from behind, or against his back, or against his chest, and another minister extends the hand of him above the instep that he touches his foot; and another minister tightens the ligament under the sole of his foot, and another minister tightens the ligature on the root of the thigh, and holds it so that it does not slip.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And it should be cut off from him or from the inside to the joint of the hip, or from behind to the joint of the two;
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And this cutting off should be done in one way, so that the hip is raised to the ground and that it hangs down by its rope.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	This species of cutting off is specific to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And therefore if the dislocation returns to the water that we have mentioned, it is good; but if not, then all species are necessary water in the treatment of itself.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the self-reduction of himself when dislocated, and if the dislocation is inwardly, then the hip should be placed on its back; and place the ligatures over the root of the thigh in that place between the top of the thigh and the place where it hurts to touch it; and extend the ligature above the joint of the hip, or below the joint of the two.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another minister should hold his legs firmly, and squeeze the large part of the hip with a violent hand, and extend it outwardly by an abrupt movement, because that one returns to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is the lightest treatment with which this limb can be reduced, better than with any of the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if you do not obey this treatment with this species of the treatment of all, then you should tie both feet of him together with a strong ligature, softly, on the toes and on the backs.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And be the length of each one with the quantity of four fingers, and let the hip curve be extended more than the other by the quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And the hip should be suspended on its head and be in the middle; and be the length of him from the ground the quantity of two bras.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And command a strong youth to cut the top of the thigh, and another youth should hang the hip from him, and the other youth should cut the thigh with a quick movement, because the joint returns to its place with speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the self-reduction when it is dislocated outwardly, then the hip should rest on the ground according to what we have said, and that it be held by its rope; and the ligature should be tightened on the curve of him, specifically and on his feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two poles should be placed, the one under his feet and the other on his head; and two poles should be raised up, one in front of him and the other behind him; and the two poles should be raised up so that the hip does not slip by them, because the extension to the inside is not pulled.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each minister should extend in its part, and the medicine should drink it according to art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey in reverse, it is good very much; but if not, then stop immediately and thus we have said to hold fast.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But the hip should be resting on its own feet quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is forward, then the curve should be extended slightly, and this is according to this story about a tree; and the medicine stops his palm from touching his hip, and immediately cuts it with the other palm, and extends it to the inside of the hip to the outside.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is backward, then you should not extend the hip to the inside, but it is raised up by its own feet on the ground; and as soon as it stops from touching a hard thing, then, according to what we have said about the extension of his hips over two large beams, and that is under its face and the ligatures are extended.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And that compression should be administered to him on a table in the place where he feels the joint.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	And the end of the reduction is that he does not turn away from you, but that you extend two beams to him, and when you see those rope and the hip expands its back slightly, then you should know that the other limb has returned; and you should tie him to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And take off the ligature and the bandage, and compare the one curve to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those knees in their place, know that the dislocation is already closed, and let them go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then turn back and put that in place, and take out that second one according to your first stretch, and leave it for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then remove that, and let that one walk a little late for a few days until he is comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of treatment of dislocation from the knie
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The dislocation is dislocated according to three ways, because it is dislocated at the outside joints, and at the inside joints, and at the joints of the sides more towards the outside joints, but not dislocated at the front joints.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation from him is that you command the patient to apply his chest to the cushion; then you will know that the dislocation has occurred.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all his ways is that you make him extend his chest, and then, if he can stand on it; place his feet under his hips, and then make him adhere his knees to his chest, and make them press against his chest; and another minister extends his feet within so that the dislocated one returns to his place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of recovery from him is that his chest adheres to the cushion without effort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then return it and make the chest adhere to the cushion, then tie them up with a cloth for three days or four, then remove them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the patient for walking for a few days until he is healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if his reduction to you is prevented, then administer firmly with the joint of his foot in the treatment of the hand preceding the narrative.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the treatment of dislocation from the head.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The head sometimes gets up again by little movement, and sometimes is dislocated completely, and the dislocation is made either at the inside joints or at the outside joints.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation from him is that the head swells up according to the joint in which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the treatment of movement from him is of light recovery, and it is done with ease according to his hand, and then he is put back in place so that he returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the treatment of him when he is dislocated completely, cover that you make the patient extend his right leg, and have another minister hold the joint from behind at the place of his head.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then turn to him towards the right hand with the leg of the uppermost part, and towards your left hand with the leg of the lowermost part in its cavity.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Then turn his feet to you with the right hand, and then with the left for two turns, and then extend them with the left; and put the feet of the foot on the right side with the chest at work.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	Then make him turn twice as you have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then extend his feet to the chest on the third turn, and you are in its cavity.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Then return him once or twice in this way, and if the foot swells up, it is good; but if not, then repeat the operation, for it will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are prohibited from reducing the patient by water which we have mentioned, then make the servant walk on his two feet on the earth, and place a cloth between the knees of the patient, and wrap him in a blanket to prevent him from slipping.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Then the servant of him holds his knees, and another minister extends his feet towards his heels or towards a cloth stretched over the top of his foot; and then extend those of the minister against the extension of his own hand, and make the cloth be extended between the knees of the patient to prevent him from slipping; and make the servant walk on his two feet so that his knees do not touch his heels.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	Then the doctor swallows up the dislocation with his hand, and another minister holds the knee at the sides, because the dislocation returns easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And so when the dislocation returns and is declared to you the health of the reduction from him, then stop applying the paste and take out that with a strong joint, and bind his feet to the chest.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	But if you fear or keep yourself from the nerves which are behind on the head, that the joint over it is not violent and it is held fast firmly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then leave him alone for two days or three; and if the joint softens, take out that one.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	Then remove that one on the third day or the fourth, and prohibit the patient from walking for ten days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is necessary to walk in front of that space, it is not necessary that the dislocation should be over him dissolved and corrupted, and then apply treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if he swells up with a fever after you have administered him in the treatment of dislocation from him which preceded the narrative, in another place of treatment and remedy, so that it gets well again.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of treatment of dislocation of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	But if that which is dislocated is put back in place by little movement, and it is not difficult to walk forward a little.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in one of the two feet, then cover that you make the patient extend his right leg on a bench or table, and let him walk as if he were walking alone.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then turn the feet to you with the right hand, and then with the left, and then extend them with the left; and then put them back in their places so that they do not appear in the same way again.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	Then place the navel of his foot on a table which is turned towards him with both feet, and then extend them with the left hand, and then put them back in their places so that they do not appear in the same way again; and then leave him alone for three days; and then remove that one and make it rest for four days before walking, so that it does not fall and its recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the types of dislocation which are caused by water or by fracture or by some other cause.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any cause of those occurs, and you are engaged in the treatment of that person and his recovery, then you will see success many times.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And do not think that the treatment of him is to boast about; but go out with mildness and mercy, and put up a little at first, and then more as needed; and leave the patient to God's judgment, but if you hope for his salvation from harm, then relieve his suffering with kindness, and show him some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	Then strive hard first to reduce him because of the cause, before he becomes sick with fever.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	Then if the member returns as we wish, then administer to him the medicine which causes fever and cure the plague with water which is sent to him by those who have dried it up.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is caused by fracture and the bones are separated, then you strive to mend them, and make them fit into place in this water which has been mentioned before in the places of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	Here is the translation of the text:
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Al-Bucasia perfectly as to which God is pleased.
Amen.	A messiess que sien per tu servat la tua saucell, e mays le vostri cos servass a Dios in saucells, e in saucells de la saucell.
